Reviews.Content: One and Done.  Plugged it into the computer and let the computer search for drivers.  Windows 7 installed the proper drivers and opened windows media center and went to the TV portion and did the setup.  Easy and works great.

Reviews.Title: Short life, average performance, slow load and unloading
Reviews.Author: WILLIS E RAGLAND
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product in December 2010 and have used it occasionally since then.  It seemed to work fine but took a long time to load and begin as well as closte out but the funcion was adequate and clear.  Yesterday it just stopped working and after trouble-shooting it I found that it is just not working anymore and will have to be replaced with a brand that is more reliable.Bill Ragland

Reviews.Title: Verbose & Inaccurate Installation Guide + Poorly Installing Software = Huge Time Waster!
Reviews.Author: GaryPAE
Reviews.Content: I just started the second recovery of my Windows/Applications partition and I'm seething inside about the amount of time that has been wasted on installing this stick.First, the installation guide is long-winded and illogical.  It doesn't explain the installation sequence clearly and concisely.  Perhaps something was lost in translation.Second, the install software on the CD gave me a choice to locate space-consuming data files on a different drive, but the very first attempt at running the program resulted in an immediate crash.  Apparently, the software forgot that it had given me an option and couldn't locate certain key files. Rather than deal with its long list of uninstall options and their totally unclear explanations, I did my first HDD recovery (thanks to Acronis True Image).My second attempt at installing the Hauppauge program was from a clean, recently reubuilt HDD, so it did manage to install correctly--mainly because this time I didn't fall for any of the "options" that it offered. It actually ran quite well the first time I fired it up; however, I made the second unfortunate mistake of going to the Hauppauge update site and downloading the "current version" of this rather primitive time-waste-ware.  Lo-and-behold, you guessed it!  Immediately after installing their new version, I tried to run it and got the same "fatal error" message as the first time.  I suppose I should have uninstalled the original CD version, but there was nothing on their site or in their documentation to advise me of that.It is obvious to me that Hauppauge cares little about the amount of time it takes for their customers to putz around with their silly TV recording software. I guess they assume that we're all a bunch of underemployed, stringy-haired hacker geeks who have plenty of free time and nothing better to do than try to guess "which way is right" in the Hauppauge install game.  Well, I won't be playing their game much longer.  If the third attempt at installing this guessware turns out the same as my first two attempts, I'll be going back to StarTech.

Reviews.Title: If you have REALLY high expectations...read on...
Reviews.Author: R. R.
Reviews.Content: I have been using Hauppauge products for many years and for the most part, I have been happy with their products. I own two of the 950Q tuners and have had them for well over a year. I've noticed that there has been problems with the TV video freezing since the recent updates in software. There are times when I have to restart the software in order to continue watching TV. I keep hoping the developers will clear up this problem for the next update of the software. There have been two updates, and the freezing/lagging is still an issue.  The company doesn't seem to have very good tech support.I can only say that I've been generally happy with their products (I've owned three different tuner models from Hauppauge).  If you have really high expectations of perfection from this product, then you might want to see if there are other options from a different manufacturer.  I tried a TV tuner from the company calle, "ATI" and in 2 months time, the ATI tuner literally fried itself and my computer's video card.

Reviews.Title: AWLFUL
Reviews.Author: Chelly
Reviews.Content: This product was a miss for me. I returned it the day I got it. I installed the program and there was a problem with decoding. I then update the program, and scanned for channels. I got NO channels at all! At first I thought it was of poor signal, i tried around the room but still none. The tuner cannot detect any channels even when the digital LED light was on. Frustrated, I gave up and packed the product back into its original packing. HORRIBLE experience. Buy at own risk.

Reviews.Title: Tuner great, remote no so,
Reviews.Author: Lionhawk
Reviews.Content: I have owner the Hauppauge TV tuner about a month.  It works great.  I connected to my cable, it found all the channels without a problem.  I am also using Windows Media Center.  They work great together.  The Windows Media Center provides a nice interface.  (Better then the default Hauppauge interrace.)  Both connected to the internet and down loaded a TV guide.  The Media Center also has my music and pictures, and plays DVDs.  Not only can you record current TV and set up future recordings, (which both can do,) the Media Center has a list of movies by category, so you can easily record them.I have two problems.  The tuner runs hot.  I am worried about how long it will last.  Second, the remote only works within a few feet.  So if you're out of reach of the keyboard, you're also most likely out of range of the remote.  It is easiler to control everything with a wireless mouse.  I would recommend getting the tuner without the remote.  Note many wireless mice have the same problem.  I recommend the Logitech M310.Note, I am using this with a standard TV input and displaying it on a 40" HDTV.  One way around having to buy HD programming.  And I can surf the internet from my recliner.

Reviews.Title: Works with Windows 7
Reviews.Author: Robert K. Blair
Reviews.Content: This is the only tv capture USB item that I can get to work with Windows 7 home premium. I have tried the ATI All Wonder USB 650 and they don't work with Windows 7 and there is not any tech support for it. The Win TV-HVR Stick is easy to install, I have it hooked up directly to cable and the remote control for Windows Media Center for Windows 7 is a nice touch

Reviews.Title: So far so good......
Reviews.Author: Glenn Shelton
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about two weeks now and am quite satisfied.Installation was very easy.....hooked it up to my cable and plugged it into the computer.Opened my media center and clicked on "live TV" and the set-up continued with a channel search.Haven't tried the remote yet....I prefer just using the mouse.My only concern is that the tuner does get pretty hot after being in use for awhile.....

Reviews.Title: Works great w/Vista, but NOT Windows 7 (low bit rate problem)
Reviews.Author: SwimNwoman
Reviews.Content: This was an AWESOME product, until I upgraded to Windows 7.  You can look everywhere for support, but it seems that Windows 7 Media Center produces this low bit rate error with most tuners, not just the winTV-HVR-950Q.  Neither Hauppage, Microsoft, or any forum posts/fixes seem to work and this has been going on for months and months with no resolution available.  So, don't waste your time & money, unless you're looking to use this with product with Vista, as this does NOT appear to be something that will be fixed in the near future, given that it's been a known problem for almost a year.  What a bummer to take such a step backwards.October 2012 update (changed from 2 to 4 stars) - I just stumbled across this review and realized that in this moment, I'm actually watching TV on my other Windows 7 laptop with this device and have been doing so for a few years now.  I've had to reinstall the operating system (long boring story) on both laptops several times and have configured this device on each machine several times.  Each time, I have to hunt down the install disk (DONT'T LOSE THIS!) AND download certain drivers and things and eventually it functions properly.  Once you finally get it configured, it works quite well.  I've been using it almost daily for about 4 years (with cable and with a digital antenna).  So, I apologize to those I may have put off with my previous review, but I really was struggling with it, until they finally came out with some Windows 7 fixes.

Reviews.Title: Works on both my Mac and Win 7
Reviews.Author: happyguy
Reviews.Content: The unit that shipped with EyeTv from Elgato died at home, I found that this is the exact same unit for $30 less. I plugged it in my Mac Mini and I was right back to TV again. I agree the remote is flimsy but I don't use it. I also plugged it into Windows 7 Ultimate 32 bit on a Dell with 2 GB and it installed itself fine without using the cds. I've used it for over 1 year with no problems on either platform.

Reviews.Title: USB TV Tuner Stick
Reviews.Author: Janice M. Howard
Reviews.Content: This was very easy to install and use.  My 6 yr old computer that had to be replaced had an internal tuner card so when I purchased a new computer I missed the tv features.  This takes care of that.  This has all the same features as you get the program guide and can record programs and save to dvd as well.  The remote will not work with the stick being installed on a desktop because it cannot connect with the sensor.  But if you were to use on a laptop you could use the remote.  I am quite pleased with this purchase as I did not want to attempt to install an internal tv tuner card.  Upon turning on your computer you need to start the WinTV application and have it buffer and tune a station before closing it and then switching to Windows Media Center for the best picture and recording features.

Reviews.Title: HVR950Q Tuner
Reviews.Author: C. Bender
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful product for those of you who are trying to dub VHS tapes onto a DVD. Just a note for you, the program they give you isn't that good, but will get the job done.  The other major think you need to know is that it WILL NOT work unless you plug it directly into your computer via one of the USB ports.

Reviews.Title: Great tuner
Reviews.Author: Z. Li "Computing"
Reviews.Content: My computer specs:Desktop: win7, cpu intel E4600 (core 2 duo 2.4ghz), visiontek hd 2400 pro graphics with 256MB, 4GB ram.Laptop: Thinkpad x61 tablet, win7, cpu intel L7500(core 2 duo 1.6ghz), integrated intel graphics card, 4gb ram.I believe just to watch TV both computers have enough horsepower, but if you need to record program, maybe higher configuration is needed.Driver installation is incredibly easy, just plug in the tuner and Win7 automatically detected it and installed the driver without using the provided CD.After I read bad reviews about their software, I decided to go ahead using windows media center only. The setup is very easy and you couldn't make it wrong.At the beginning I was using the small antenna came with the tuner indoor, and WMC didn't detect any channel. To make sure everything is set properly, I went out with both the small antenna and my newly purchased antenna direct DB2 to the parking lot and with both it detected about 20 channels. You wouldn't believe the signal unless you see it, amazing :), crystal clear. Considering that I am around 28 miles from NYC the reception is great. After making sure everything was set up fine, I brough the antennas into the house and tried to find different positions to get better signal. I live in the first floor of a two-story apartment, and there are a lot of trees around it. But finally I did manage to get a few channels inside the room. NBC, Fox, CBS and PBS (which are UHF channels) and a few other local channels are great. I cannot get ABC since it's using VHF. The DB2 is better than the antenna came with the tuner.As others mentioned, I am afraid the tuner becomes hot too soon. You may need to take a rest after a while, or try other method to cool it down. After watching 1-hour TV, it's becoming very hot. Not sure if you can continue to use it for a long time without problems. I think it comes with 2-year limited warranty.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be easier
Reviews.Author: Tom Long "Author of the Juice of Life"
Reviews.Content: Hooked this up to the cable from the wall and my new computer.  Without installing drivers or anything else, just turned on the computer with Windows 7 (64 bit) and went to Windows Media Center.  Went through the TV setup wizard and it found all the cable channels.  Digital reception is flawless and looks awesome on my 50" TV.  Analog reception is perhaps 10% worse than what I get with the cable plugged straight into the TV.  The little extensible antenna gets better reception than my rabbit ears did.  Couldn't get the credit card style remote to do anything but maybe it works if you use WinTV instead of Windows Media Center.  I use the Mobile Air Mouse on my iPhone for a remote so I didn't care.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick/Personal Video Recorder with Clear QAM and Remote Control (Black)
Reviews.Author: Merrick Blaisdell
Reviews.Content: The Hauppauge WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick/Personal Video Recorder with Clear QAM and Remote Control (Black) has worked out as I expected, the quality is very good off my existing setup without anything to amplify the strength.  I prefer to use windows media center so I can't review the software fairly.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Windows Media Center
Reviews.Author: Professor
Reviews.Content: Got this for Windows Media Center running on Vista.  Vista recognized the tuner and installed the necessary driver without having to install the CD.  To keep your computer clean, I always recommend to see if Windows recognizes new hardware before installing the junk on the included CD's.  After automatically installing the driver, I opened Windows Media Center (MCE) and it saw the new tuner.  It is connected to the antenna on the house and the reception appears to be perfect.  I like this better than using an internal card.  The computer came with an ATI 650 HD internal tuner.  It had reception problems when the case cover was on (heat?).

Reviews.Title: Software Is Unstable, Unusable Under Vista
Reviews.Author: Bad Purchase
Reviews.Content: Garbage.  Under Vista, software is unusable.  Analog viewing causes continuous CPU max out, meaning your computer can't be used for anything useful while watching TV.  Software freezes after approximately every 3 channel changes.  Software falsely reports tuning errors, meaning you can't watch a channel until you restart software.  IR Remote is non-functional.  Buy a television instead.

Reviews.Title: Delivers as promised
Reviews.Author: T. Rathburn
Reviews.Content: The 950Q and WinTv7 installed easily and provide a very simple way to view and record.  Picture quality is excellent on my PC.  I wish it could identify the clear QAM channels better and I wish it came with a way to burn recordings to DVDs that would play on my TV.  I found VideoReDo online for $70 and it works for editing and burning.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good tuner.  Kind of clunky SW
Reviews.Author: AmazonReviewer001
Reviews.Content: I'm mainly using this to tune unencrypted QAM.  The quality for digital cable seems very good.  The quality of analog cable is not as good, but that doesn't bother me because I won't be watching much if any analog.The built in software is nowhere near is good as Windows Media Center.  It doesn't have a program guide, and doesn't know the names of the channels.  But unfortunately I'm stuck with it until I get my copy of Windows 7, which will handle digital channels.The included remote looks a little cheap, but I haven't used it.  I programmed my Harmony universal remote to control the tuner, and that works wellUpdate after using this for a couple of months:The driver crashes a couple of times a week for no apparent reason.  Rebooting seems to be the only way to fix it.Also, the tuner won't tune some QAM channels that my TV picks up.Subtracting one star for these issues, and another because their online customer service never responded to me.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: A. Calderon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item so as to use in Iraq on deployment. I initially tried out in the states before leaving. Real simple, installed the program and I was off and running in no time. I bit hard at first but, half a brain and a little reading pulled me thru. I'm in Iraq and I am watching AFN with no problem. The remote could use some tweaking, but other than that, I truly recommend this product, simple and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Not useful
Reviews.Author: Rudy Zhao "rudy"
Reviews.Content: The installation etc was not very complicated. However, the receptor got really hot quickly, and the quality of graphs deteriorated quickly, which is irritating.  I only used it twice and lost interest in it.  I won't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Hardware GREAT/ Software SUCKS!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: OG "loslobos"
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is screw wintv software 6 & 7.  Use KMPLAYER with your 950q and you will not be disappointed.  I get all of my analog channels with no stutter or pc freeze ups.  My slim line computer has a 1.2 ghz amd athlon processor with 2 gigs of ram.  Tried to get analog with wintv - only 6 channels.  wintv qam scanned 4 channels that showed hd.  big wup!  KMPLAYER ROCKS.[...]

Reviews.Title: Great tuner, OK software
Reviews.Author: J. Duncan
Reviews.Content: The tuner is excellent and picks up stations that my digital TV does not, even though both use the same roof antenna.  The software is a little clunky and occasionally locks up on my Vista system.  I wish it wouldn't overwrite found channels when it finds another with the same number.  For example, when I scan with the antenna pointed to the east, it will pick up a channel 20 and save it.  Then, another day, I may scan with the antenna pointed to the west and the tuner will find a different channel 20.  It seems to only be able to save one or the other.  I've tried renaming them, but that didn't work.  For anyone simply wanting to watch TV on their PC, this is a great tuner to have.

Reviews.Title: Completely satisfied
Reviews.Author: Lanny Bott
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews of this product before making my purchase. I find this product to be better than I expected based on the reviews I read.The software provided with the product is easy to use. The hardware works easily with Windows Media Center in Vista Premium.

Reviews.Title: flawless, very impressive
Reviews.Author: Varvara1234
Reviews.Content: great product. Received last night. Installation was super easy and the tuner with the little antenna immediately provided great HD TV on my laptop. Worked faster than on my 46 inches LCD TV. I have not yet tried to plug it into the satellite receiver box or to record.

Reviews.Title: Decent Tuner for a very reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Alex Csura "Dr. Z"
Reviews.Content: Was pretty much what I expected. Connected effortlessly via theUSB cable to my Compaq computer that's running Windows Vista Home Premiumedition. Computer has 250GB HD and 2 Gigs or RAM.Connected directly from the incoming coax cable (which was previously just to connect to my cable modem, but I've had a splitter on it for a previous video tuner I used on my older computer that ran Win XP (It was an external ATI TV Wonder tuner, which did not work on my currect computer).Anyway, directions are simple and straightforward. After having my local cable company's channels downloaded in the program/computer, it ran fine right after that. It has its own viewer program, but I prefer using Windows Media Center and the Live TV function. With Media Center, you get to see channel, program name, brief summary of program, and program running time.My only problem was that it didn't download/recognize about 4-5 channelsthat I used to have with my old ATI TV Wonder tuner. Neither of these missing channels show up on the integrated viewer provided, or on Media Center. The only really notable one being TLC (The Learning Channel),which for some reason doesn't show up on its normal channel (28 in my area). It shows the other normal expected channels in my area (from 2-73), since the ones higher up require a digital cable box (which I have for the 3 TVs in my home), and wasn't expecting to get them anyway, since I alreadt knew from my last ATI TV Wonder Tuner, that these encrypted channels don't show up. All in all 4/5 stars for the price,ease of use and functionality. The included mini remote would work fineif my computer case wasn't under my desk, out of direct sight view needed to operate the remote. The Tuner stick needs to be in the openif you want to use the remote (which I have no need for). So, if those few missing channels were there, I'd rate it a 5/5. I'm happy since I don't watch TLC on my computer anyway, and the few other channels are ones I don't watch anyway.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed after 4 weeks
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Finnell "Soilman"
Reviews.Content: Was well pleased out of the box.  Use it on a Gateway laptop T2080@ 1.73GHz and 2 Gig RAM.  Worked fine the first 3 weeks using the antenna that comes with it.  Seven analog and about 12 digital channels.  The fourth week it quit finding channels and now finds only 3 analog and 3 digital.  Nothing changed - digital stations still broadcase - but it no longer can find signals.  I am planning to return the product since "support" has yet to return my email.  I would be wary of purchase and make sure you keep the receipts.  This is my first attempt to return to amazon.

Reviews.Title: Did not recognize cable QAM
Reviews.Author: Roger B
Reviews.Content: The WinTV-HVR-950Q is a nice concept and looked like a good product but did not meet my requirements, so I have returned it.  I have cable and want to have a DVR for the local digital (including HD) QAM broadcasts.  My two digital televisions have no problem picking up the QAM broadcasts.  The 950Q "found" some QAM stations but could not display the broadcast.  It did wonderful on the cable analog stations and if I was interested in the obsolete analog, this is a good unit. The analog and digital cable scan time was almost 40 minutes.I downloaded the latest drivers and WinTV, but those did not help.  My machine is a Core 2 Duo high end machine with 4GB of memory running Vista Home Premium.  Windows media center did not find any digital stations on the cable that it cared to mention.I tried the 950Q with the OTA antenna and managed to pick up a few digital stations even though I am located > 20 miles from the transmitter towers. However, the reception was very choppy as expected at such a long distance.

Reviews.Title: Awful, awful product.
Reviews.Author: Michael Grubbs
Reviews.Content: Getting the software working on Vista 64 is a nightmare. I downloaded the latest version, thinking that would be the best way to go , only to get Blue Screens Of Death each time. Then I tried the version that came with the unit, it would actually start at least, but would then freeze and give me Unhandled Memory Exception errors. I even tried going into MSConfig and disabling almost every other app or service that started at boot, no luck.This thing is in my dumpster where it belongs.Never again will I buy another Hauppauge product. These people need to get a clue and realize that the 64bit OS has ben around for just a little while and it would help to develop their application to support it.

Reviews.Title: Great ClearQAM tuner
Reviews.Author: Mateus49
Reviews.Content: I've been using this tuner Hauppauge WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick/Personal Video Recorder with Clear QAM and Remote Control (Black)for over a week now and it is great.  I am running it on a laptop with Windows Vista Premium (32 bit).  You have to do some work to get Vista to recognize clearQAM.1. Use Windows Update to install all critical updates.2. Download & install TVpack 2008 for Vista3. Download & install PlayReady (to insure your DRM rights are up-to-date)4. Use Windows Update to install all critical updates. (will change because of TVpack 2008)5. Use regedit to add this parameter:  Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\hcw72DTV\Parameters(add parameter AllowQAM_PowerToy with DWORD = 1)6. plug in your new tuner stick & let Vista load the drivers7. Fire up Media Center and got to settings "Set up your TV signal": there you will see the WinTV-HVR-950Q as a clearQAM tuner.8. After you scan your channels you will have to spend a half day on assigning listings but it is worth it.My hardware is Intel T2080 @ 1.73 GHz with 2GB Ram and only integrated graphics (3.0 Vista rating)and after the initial warm up the video runs great with no stutters.  I can now record TV and either show it on my home theater of take it with me on the plane.  Media Center is great software and this tuner runs on it just fine.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Did not work properly
Reviews.Author: Tech Guy "Straightarrow"
Reviews.Content: This product did not work as advertised.  Only once did it pick up digitalstations.  I am running Vista with 4GB of ram.  Plenty of horse power.Amazon refunded my money quickly and did a good job of customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: Need a super computer to run it!
Reviews.Author: G. Bonebrake
Reviews.Content: Both my 2.3 GHz tower and 2.4 GHz laptop choke when attempting to decode the video. I hate the scenario - buy a new gadget and end up completely revamping my computers to support it!

Reviews.Title: Had lots of problems
Reviews.Author: crocagator
Reviews.Content: I returned this item after 3 frustrating days of trying to make it work. I am somewhat of an IT professional and have built several computers. This unit was even worse then the Pinnacle unit which I thought was as bad as it gets. I ended up having to restore my computer to an earlier date which thank goodness was available.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: M. Pfeiffer
Reviews.Content: The Hauppauge 950Q picks up both air and cable signals very well. I am currently using it with Media Center and it has recorded flawlessly. The provided antenna is weak. I have been using the leaf antenna. A high gain antenna will give exceptional reception.

Reviews.Title: Great Addition to Cable-Free Living!
Reviews.Author: S. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: Since I graduated college I have refused to pay for cable. I'm not home enough to find it worth having a monthly bill. I have a great antenna with a built-in converter and amplifier, cost me $35 over a year ago and it currently gets me 29 free OTA channels. This tv turner has been amazing. I use it with the Windows 7 Media Center that was already on my PC. Installed the driver when I plugged the tv turner into the USB port and completed set-up through Windows Media Center (I did not install the software that's on the disc). Put the smaller antenna that came with the turner next to my old faithful antenna so it could pick up the same channels. Voila! Windows Media Center does the rest of the work (program guide, records shows even while laptop is asleelp, etc). I keep old faithful hooked up to my tv and the smaller antenna with the tv turner hooked up to laptop so i can watch one show and record another show at the same time. I also use the tv turner to record shows that air when I'm not home or I'm asleep. It doesn't make any noise and won't heat up past warm. I'm so glad i bought this tv turner. Does exactly what I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: A good product -- works well for me.
Reviews.Author: Marijo
Reviews.Content: I tried several TV tuners before settling on the Hauppauge.  I had to return the others.  I'm keeping this one.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased.
Reviews.Author: J. Pierce
Reviews.Content: This device works great for me. I have used it with all forms of input, analog TV, digital ATSC, digital clear quam and external inputs (composite and S-video). The software documentation could have been a little better, especially the link between the device software and the TV listing service for which a link was provided. After editing the preset channel IDs to match the listing channel IDs I am able to watch or schedule a recording from the Titan TV listing web site. There is one nuisance factor when watching a program. It sometimes starts with the wrong audio stream or no audio. Correcting this requires a right click and selecting the desired audio stream.

Reviews.Title: UNIT FUNCTIONS EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED
Reviews.Author: Sharon Schilling
Reviews.Content: I use my unit to record Live TV movies.  This unit works exactly as described.  The documentation is poor.  You do need to go online to learn how to use it.  The software is very good but there is no button for "live TV" on the controls.  This is the only flaw I find.If you wish to record and burn your own CDs, this is a very good unit for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Worked Right Out Of The Box
Reviews.Author: J E P
Reviews.Content: Simple installation, works great. Coulsn't use dvd as I have no drive so downloaded the software. Installed and it works. Can record and playback. I would recommend. OS in Windows 8.1 on a 11.6 netbook with Intel Celeron 1.5ghz 4 gb ram..

Reviews.Title: Seems to work fairly well
Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: Bought this to watch tv on my laptop while I work out.  Its hooked to my secondary output on my Dish Network receiver. I like that it's compact and does not require an external power source.  Also, the coax input is exactly what I needed for my application.  Only issue is that there's like a two second delay for every button I push on my Dish remote, not sure where the fault lies there, but when I use the same remote with a tv upstairs, the response is much better.

Reviews.Title: works well with XP, Vista, Win 7, and Win 8.
Reviews.Author: Michael G. Russell
Reviews.Content: Been using this for years to record HDTV programs with windows media center.  Also used it to scout out TV reception in my car.  Comes with a nifty little magnetic antenna that I've used for other devices.  No problems.

Reviews.Title: No software for Mac, you have to pay for 3rd party
Reviews.Author: Mark Gehring
Reviews.Content: It is really annoying that it comes with free Windows software that works well, but nothing for Mac. I also could not get this working inside the Mac by using Virtual Box to run XP under OSX. It will not run the install as it cannot "see" the USB stick, even though the Virtual Box software can see it. So, I had to get out an old PC I had laying around to use this. I use it as a poor man's DVR. We don't have cable, and like to record some off air stuff like PBS or an occasional ball game. My bad rating is for lack of Mac software. However, running on a PC its works quite well.

Reviews.Title: TIVO capabilities on your laptop - works better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Works fantastic on my Acer laptop with Windows 7 Media Center. I hooked it up to my outside antenna (I'm not a cable guy), ran the Windows Media Center setup, and it recognized the tuner and found all my local channels. This is the cheapest TIVO alternative around. All my favorite TV shows are recorded to my laptop hard drive without fail. Media Center allows you to set up multiple recordings of your favorite shows and even let's you choose not to record reruns. WARNING IF YOU HAVE A WINDOWS 8 SYSTEM. Many new Windows 8 computers come installed with version 8.0, which doesn't include Media Center. Microsoft wants $99 before you can upgrade to version 8.1. Hauppage does include their own TV viewing and recording software but isn't nearly as robust as Media Center.I have not used the included remote control because I use a wireless mouse-keyboard and don't need it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent. Been using mine for over a year now!
Reviews.Author: Burnt Halo 7
Reviews.Content: I was browsing through the tuners, when I found this! I've been using mine now for well over a year now, with Windows 7 64 bit OS. I use it exclusively with Windows Media Center on a laptop hooked to a 42in HD TV. I don't use the included antenna or remote, so I can't rate them. But the tuner is solid, and has never given me a single problem. I see a lot of negative reviews which I find amusing. Jokes aside, you may need to do some configuring, it's a PC! If you have ZERO tech skill, skip stuff like this it will frustrate you too much. Bottom line.... Cost me about $70, I've never missed one of my shows since, picture and sound are great, item is very reliable.  Would I buy it again, absolutely!!!

Reviews.Title: It just doesn't work
Reviews.Author: J.D.
Reviews.Content: While the theory behind this product is great, the execution is pitiful.  I have attempted to use this device with Windows XP, Windows 7, and Linux and it is a complete disaster to try to configure.  On Windows, it just hangs when attempting to initialize, even when installing the latest drivers.  After two weeks of failing to get even the most basic operations to work, I finally give up.This is the second Hauppauge product I have used over the years, and they both was been less than satisfactory.  I can assure you, this is my last try with this company.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge TV-HVR- 950Q and 2250 Tuners
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I ordered a Win TV-HVR-950Q in late November of 2009. I did not use it very much as I record programs on RW DVD's for later watching. Earlier this year, I purchased an OTA Antenna, due to the high monthly charge, and dropped my cable subscription. In April, I ordered a Win TV-HVR-2250 with the Media Center Kit. In my opinion, both the remote for the 950Q and the Media Center Kit are useless as neither worked.Neither tuner is very reliable as I never know if they will work the next time I want to use them. I have tried both with XP, XP Professional, Vista and Windows 7. I currently have the 2250 installed in my Windows 7 computer. Yesterday it was working fairly well and found over a dozen channels but today it has only found 10 channels, some of which are not working very well, The 950Q is currently connected to a Vista computer and has found 17 channels, all of which are working well. The next time I try to use either tuner; they may show as no tuner available as that happens frequently. I have reloaded and or scanned for channels numerous times, using both tuners. When I turn them on, they frequently indicate there is no tuner available. When they are working, I never know when they will just stop working.I do not have either tuner connected to my OTA Antenna, but have them connected to my Internet Cable, yes, I said Internet Cable. I don't know why but I am getting channels which I did not get with my regular cable. Some of them were only available in the next higher group, meaning some are movie channels. I don't know if this is typical or not, but as long as I am receiving them on my Internet Cable, I will continue to watch or record them when something is on which I want to see.

Reviews.Title: Perpetually fickle product
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: This product has generally worked for us for the past 3 years or so, but it is very fickle.  There are times you have to shut it down and restart it for it to render the TV picture correctly.  I've now installed the device on a new Windows 8 machine and downloaded the latest drivers for it, and although it is reportedly compatible it isn't work at all any longer.I don't know if there's a better product out there or not for this purpose, but I'd look hard for one before buying this device.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jeff Wilson
Reviews.Content: This has worked great and with virtually no setup on my Windows 8 machine.  I use it with Windows Media Center as a DVR and it has never let me down.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Dudley
Reviews.Content: We use the WinTv software to record shows while our daughter is at dance.  It basically works but there is a little jitter.  The program feature is buggy and we haven't had it work yet.This meets are requirements without having to spend a lot more on a DVR box.

Reviews.Title: Didn't Work
Reviews.Author: James E. Herget
Reviews.Content: I was unable to get the device to work at all.  I tried the Hauppauge email support, but did not get a reply for about a week.  At this point I had just returned the item.

Reviews.Title: We have 3 of these
Reviews.Author: Mommo TC
Reviews.Content: We use these tuners on our computers.  We are able to get up to 40 usable channels.  Installation was easy and the reception is great.  We did use the software to install drivers but not the WinTv--we use Windows Media center, which is much easier to use and gives us a full screen picture.

Reviews.Title: don't lose the cd
Reviews.Author: tecweasel
Reviews.Content: worked ok on my xp machine, wanted to use with win7, OH WAIT, you HAVE TO HAVE the CD to install their software.  HAVE TO HAVE THEIR CD, the ORIGINAL ONE, and if you don't, oh well, they will gladly sell you another one for $10.  You can download the software from their site, yeah, the ENTIRE PACKAGE, but if you don't have the original CD, TOO BAD. even the entire package you download from their website requires the CD.Companies that screw customers like this deserve to go out of business.

Reviews.Title: works well enough with WD TV Live
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It's easy to set up, just plug it in, start the Hauppauge app on the WD box, scan for channels and start watching live TV.  It even received the channel map and program guide data.  The included USB extension cable was a nice touch.  The only negative so far is that changing the channel can take 5 seconds.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: obachan, CA
Reviews.Content: I purchased Hauppauge 1191 to use with my laptop to catch a TV channel which is not on the cable service. Installation was very easy and it caught more channels I have expected. Images are very clear. Actually they are better than the one I could caught with the "rabbit" antena in the past. Very nice product.

Reviews.Title: Really Works
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain
Reviews.Content: I've tried other USB tuners and have found them to be twitchy, iffy, and - bottom line - mostly more trouble than they're worth.This thing is an exception since it works without a problem on my Windows 7 64 bit machine.I'm very happy with it

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for recording broadcast TV
Reviews.Author: Publius
Reviews.Content: One of the best computer products I've ever gotten. Easy to set up & Easy to use. Outstanding in every way.

Reviews.Title: Great Inexpensive TV
Reviews.Author: Retired Guy
Reviews.Content: This device coupled with a laptop computer can be the basis of a very good video entertainment system.  There is no need to pay for cable when one can easily get most popular TV coverage over the air in most metropolitan areas.

Reviews.Title: Works flawlessly
Reviews.Author: 2012Review
Reviews.Content: I have always had confidence in Hauppauge products and this one did not disappoint me. The 1191 and its software worked flawlessly out of the box with my ASUS laptop and its Windows 7 OS. Seeing HDTV on my laptop was an amazing experience and the 1191 interface and software will permit me to capture and convert my old VHS collection to DVD. Thank you Hauppauge for another great product.

Reviews.Title: I had problems, but they may have been my fault
Reviews.Author: Tedd
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time getting this thing to work initially. I'm generally quite tech-savvy, but for some reason I could not get any channels initially. To make a long story short, it eventually started working after a few hours (and an upgrade to Windows 8), and it seems to work well now.I give it four stars because the picture quality is quite good, the scheduling works well, and it otherwise meets my needs. Living in NYC, the included antenna is almost worthless, and the remote isn't that useful for my setup, but I am happy with this product. I also believe the difficulty I had in setting up this device was likely the result of problems with my computer (other devices also did not work properly until my clean OS install), so I have not deducted any stars for my problems.

Reviews.Title: It works... but it's a pain
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: This tuner will work if you want to watch TV on your computer or laptop.  However, I recommend using Windows Media Center instead of the preloaded software it comes with.  It will be a much more pleasant experience.At times it can be really annoying if something isn't working and it can't find the tuner.  I've had to reinstall the drivers countless times. Don't even both buying if you want to be able to use the RCA cables to play video games.  There is a 2.5 second delay for the controller response.Overall, it's not that great but it will allow you to watch TV.  However, it is a huge pain.  I would recommend passing on this one.

Reviews.Title: It's a TV - a PC - a TIVO...
Reviews.Author: TechnoAmazonian
Reviews.Content: A very nice device in a compact package.  Mine arrived with a new and better remote (not the smooth surface bubble buttons as shown, but with regular buttons - not a smooth credit card remote) and the latest software optical disk.  Agree with other reviewers - go to the web site and use all the latest software and drivers, and get a better antenna if you can afford to (the "Mohu Leaf" people are recommending, with the longer antenna cable or extension if needed).  You probably won't find a better unit to do what it does for the price.  Editor's Choice in some PC magazines, and recommended by Maximum PC as their favorite for free-over-air HDTV.  A powerful modern laptop should run it fine, so check requirements.  You need to be near a broadcast station (about 10 miles) to get good signal and many stations with the smaller portable antennas.  Learn more about free over the air HDTV before you buy.  See [...] and [...] to see what programming is available and what channels you might be able to see at your address.

Reviews.Title: Amazing invention
Reviews.Author: L. Cortese
Reviews.Content: I love this product, but I don't use the software it came with. Getting it to work with Windows Media Center instead was a great idea and I get more channels to come up than with the program it came with. I had to move the antenna around my laptop a lot at first to make sure I could get all the channels I wanted to work and now it's great. I have it scheduled to record a show every week and it actually works and I don't even have to pay for a monthly DVR which is so awesome. The TV channels come in crystal clear HD. This product is well worth it and I just hope it holds up for a long time! Not sure why it has such bad reviews. It's an easy product to use if you are lucky enough to be in an area with a good over the air TV signal. I say just plug it in and download everything you need to get it to work with WMC instead of the WinTV7 software it came with. You will notice a big difference. WMC interface makes this product 10x better!

Reviews.Title: One of the best items I've ever bought
Reviews.Author: Carla Joy
Reviews.Content: I love this thing. I recently dumped cable (which was costing me $1800 a year) in favor of a broadband plan and TV antenna in the attic run to my TVs with CAT6 lines, and a subscription to Netflix and Amazon Prime (all of which costs me around $300 a year, depending on how many shows I get). But that didn't fix the issue of how to record programs if I'm watching something else, and I didn't want to pay the high-price for a DVR. And why would I, when my computers have more than enough room to record TV shows? A friend gave me an older model of this HDTV stick to use with my laptop, but it didn't work with Windows 7. (Do your research!) I found this one, which was recommended for Windows 7, easily installed the software and set it up in my kitchen with the little antenna in the kitchen window. (You can go to [...] to see where your signal is strongest, and I live close to the signals. If not, I could always hook it up to the antenna cable from the TV antenna.) I get some 20 free stations, and the software that comes with it makes it super easy to record a show. Works perfectly! I watched (insert crappy summer reality show here) and recorded (insert ANOTHER crappy reality show here) on the laptop and just watched it later. Free TV rocks!

Reviews.Title: Works with Vista Business - UPDATE
Reviews.Author: Wabash Slim
Reviews.Content: For a spare I bought an older surplus HP laptop that came loaded with Vista Business. Since it had an HDMI connector I've begun using it to stream Netflix and thought I'd put the near-empty harddrive to use as a DVR for over-the-air broadcasts. Since Vista Business lacks Media Center and many other media playthings I (and the store clerk) had some doubts about whether this thing would work but I was glad to see it functions as advertised - that is, as advertised both by Hauppauge AND the many Amazon users who report bugs in the WinTV 7 software. After a few hours I've learned how to dodge some problems by avoiding certain key sequences or by not going too fast, particularly when changing channels using the up-down buttons. I haven't tried the supplied remote yet; I do everything onscreen using a wireless mini-keyboard with media keys. My amplified outside antenna comes down into a splitter with one output going to the TV's antenna in, the other output goes to the tuner stick so I can record independently of what I'm watching. No problems with signal loss but I do notice the HDMI picture from the computer is often (not always) inferior to the direct antenna feed by being a tad washed-out or grainy. This I compensated for by making and saving a suitable video preset on the TV (I have no such issue with Netflix or other streaming HD) There's also a very noticeable volume drop. On the other hand this USB stick is a heck of a lot cheaper than a Tivo or obsolete DVR for just recording a few (usually old) shows a week.As a side note I tried downloading and installing NextPVR as an alternative recording program - got many error messages during the install and while I was eventually able to get a picture and a mostly-blank guide, overall it was a far worse program than WinTV7 feature-wise.UPDATE Dec. 2012: After using this for awhile w/ Vista Business it's been an extremely frustrating experience. For one thing I found if I used the video input dongle for composite or S-video recording I had a devil of a time getting it to record TV channels again. The Scheduler is extremely touchy, will stop working for no reason and it seems once it is working, any disturbance to the computer or Scheduler will kill it. The only fix is to reboot the computer each time. I'm going to install Windows 7 on all my machines, we'll see. I'm starting to doubt that the savings over Tivo is worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: TV Tuner for Computer
Reviews.Author: Keith B. Marcantel "Keith19"
Reviews.Content: This worked well on my computer through a cable box.  It also worked on a netbook for on air programming.

Reviews.Title: Purchased from Amazon and all is well
Reviews.Author: Jerry Johnston
Reviews.Content: i believe it is a quality product. It installed and works well. A little more expensive than another one but then the other one didn't work out so well so I sent it back and got this one and am satisfied.What more could the customer, Amazon or the manufacturer, Hauppauge, ask for but satisfaction all around.Hauppauge 1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick/Personal Video Recorder with Clear QAM and Remote Control (Black)

Reviews.Title: Decent hardware-bad software
Reviews.Author: A. Invencio
Reviews.Content: Used the product a few times, but continually had problems with the pause feature. The software continually lost the paused video and we were fast forwarded to live tv. Without being able to pause the product is a glorified VCR. Going to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Didnt work for my specific needs
Reviews.Author: Jamie Johnson
Reviews.Content: Granted I got this unit for a purpose other than what it was designed for, so I still gave it a 3. It did pick up cable channels in the area, but says you need a separate rooftop antenna to get reception, so I wasnt able to watch anything (returned the unit).If you are looking to capture a wireless video transmission from a camcorder THIS UNIT WILL NOT WORK. It does not state that it will work for this purpose, but does say it will capture "cable channel 59" (the channel of my wireless video camera transmitter, but still wont capture that frequency.I'm sure it works great for some, but would recommend calling the company and speaking to tech support before purchasing.NOTE: email tech support is not effective, a phone call with put you in direct tough with someone knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Gumby
Reviews.Content: Simple to configure.  Used Windows Media Center and not the WINTV software that came with it.  Included antenna worked well for over the air HD and the pulled all my cable channels.

Reviews.Title: It's a FREE Tivo(r) for your computer.
Reviews.Author: toobig4u
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is as good as any HD TV i've seen.Recording is as easy as any traditional DVR. My laptop (Lenovo w/i5 chip) has a HDMI output so i can playback on a TV.I live in Houston and with the included antenna, I can get lots of channels. best quality comes from an outdoor HD antenna.Easy, easy setup.  Be sure to use MS Media Center after installing all the software...i found it to be completely reliable.In a sentence: Great little product i'd recommend 100%.cheers.

Reviews.Title: Great Tuner
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: This is my third one. They work great with Windows 7 Media Center. I made the mistake of buying a 1950. What a piece of garbage. I am replacing it with one of these. My other ones have worked for over a year with no intervention on my part. Just set it and forget it. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge 1191
Reviews.Author: Pen1name
Reviews.Content: Product was Described and worked better than expected..Only ran into one problem not mentioned in the how to work the product..To record or view the options to record, you have to right click on the open space of the the Tv viewing area to access this feature..I had to accidently do this to discover this..The Description of how to use should state this more clearly..One review said that the remote was worthless and I agree ..But it works fine with the mouse used..For 70 dollars I am now able to record on an antenna powered tv..that at Sears was going to cost 300.dollars.Setting the time up..Channel ..Putting the computer to sleep..and as long as the signal is strong..the program is recorded..Only other feature a little bothersom ..Is it is set on ,Military time for recording..But all in all..The product is easier to use than a lot of older Vcr's were..

Reviews.Title: Great Windows TV tuner
Reviews.Author: Jim McIntosh
Reviews.Content: We bought the Hauppauge WinTV.v7 to replace a Dish DVR.  It installed easily and is a better tuner than the "built-ins" in our PCs or Home Theater.  All of the channels we expected are there and more besides.  We use a "roof top" antenna for the over-the-air signals.  The key to a smooth interface with Windows Media Center is the Hauppauge WMC driver (their web site under WMC) and the changes in release 2.4c - also available from the Hauppauge site.  WinTV and WMC work as expected (cannot run both at the same time) and the tuner operation is easy to master.

Reviews.Title: Great tuner, easy setup
Reviews.Author: Martini
Reviews.Content: I was just looking for an easy way to record some TV shows.  I plugged it in, used Windows Media Center, and I was up and running in no time.

Reviews.Title: Great for WMC PVR.
Reviews.Author: Drake Johnson
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the Hauppauge 1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner.  I have had this exact model on my personal PC for about 1 year.  I just build a HTPC (Home Theater PC) and liked this unit so much I bought another.  I haven't used the remote (I purchase an AmuletDevices remote instead).  With that said, what I really like about this unit is, once the drivers are loaded in Windows 7 just go to Windows Media Center (WMC) and set it up.  I do not use the software that comes with the TV tuner, why would I when Microsoft has done such a great job on WMC.Quick note:  I use this with a roof mounted HD antenna in San Francisco.  I get about 70 stations all in HD.  WMC gives me a PVR and TV guide, all for free.

Reviews.Title: Solid and versatile product. Highly recommended for Windows 7 MC
Reviews.Author: Vadue
Reviews.Content: I have had this product (actually 2 of them) for almost 2 years now and have not had a single problem with either of them. All I had to do was plug them into my computer running Windows 7 and Windows 7 detected and installed the drivers automatically. Within about 5 minutes I was able to watch/record live TV on one channel and record live TV on another simultaneously through Windows Media Center without a single problem. I have also set up my Xbox 360 in my bedroom so that I can be watching live or recorded TV on my Xbox 360 flawlessly while watching live or recorded TV on my computer. I love how the Xbox 360 can turn on the "Hauppauge WinTV-HVR-950Q Hybrid TV Stick" that is plugged into my Windows 7 computer and start watching live TV on my Xbox 360. I also figured out that the IR remote software that comes with the "Hauppauge WinTV-HVR-950Q Hybrid TV Stick" will make my Xbox 360 Windows Media Center Universal Remote start working on my Windows Media Center installed on my Windows 7 computer and also every button works without me doing anything other then installing and running the IR remote software. I have nothing but complete success with this produce and HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend it to anyone that wants to turn a Windows 7 computer into a Media Center/Entertainment Center. Even the digital surround sound works from live and recorded TV through these things.

Reviews.Title: HD baby
Reviews.Author: lakotaed
Reviews.Content: I have Microsoft Office Pro and it has Media center that allows me to record HD broadcasts in advance.  It is HD and it looks great on my laptop.  I had no idea all those channels were out there, but I am in SoCal and we may have more than some.  The only caveat is that the antenna must be set up to ensure that the reception for that channel is optimal.  I often watch in an area that has too many large buildings and this screws up reception, but that has nothing to do with the device.  The signals are ground signals, not satellite signals so large obstacles reduce reception quality.  So long as I get my Ghost Whisperer I am cool with it.  FYI, it does get hot, but I have had it for over a year and it still works fine.  It has a remote!! How cool is that?!

Reviews.Title: worked fine
Reviews.Author: Glenn A. Sopfe
Reviews.Content: Worked great on my windows 7 laptop, I even used it on a LINUX box for MythTV and got it working - some configuration settings took time but it worked - my class project - I got an A.

Reviews.Title: Very Excellent Product...so far
Reviews.Author: Benny Bonito "BB"
Reviews.Content: I just received this product in the mail yesterday.  Upon setting up the device with my macbook pro and using elgato's EyeTV 3 Software, this TV tuner worked FLAWLESSLY.  It picked up all my basic cable channels and even the digital cable channels too.  It also switches between the analog and digital stations with ease.  I plugged in the composite video adapter it came with to test it out with my PS2.  That too also gave me no problems what-so-ever.  It was able to pick up my PS2 signal with ease and I was able to play my games with little trouble.  I haven't used the hauppauge software so I don't know how it would function with that, but EyeTV is just great.  Since I never used it on a PC, my review is solely based on functionality with a macbook so my recommendation would be for mac users who want to watch tv stations, but don't want to pay the hefty price of the elgato eyeTV hybrid.  I'd say this is a pretty good alternative to that.

Reviews.Title: Good Product/Deceptive Advertisement
Reviews.Author: Vinchenzzi
Reviews.Content: I have been using this for about 2 weeks and I am happy with it. When you are just using the antenna the picture with media player is awesome. I had no problem loading it up, I plugged it in and I was watching TV. However I did not buy it for that feature. I bought it for my boat which has a Satellite direct tv. I plugged it in and followed all the directions but every time it got to the end where it was supposed to say, you are now hooked up , it said could not find IR Controller. So I called customer service and for another 30 or 40 bucks( I forget exactly what was said) I could buy an adaptor so it would work with the remote that comes with it or I could install there WinTV software and just use the SAT TV remote. Which is what I did and it works, but the picture is not so good. It doesnt suck but it looked so much better in media player( SO MUCH BETTER) I was not pleased that I had to buy something else to watch tv and if I heard the gentleman correct it only has to do with the remote, not the SAT.So I was disapointed with that but still will keep it, it works good enough. I also wanted to say something to all the HATERS regarding the remote being so small and flimsy. I think it is perfect for this application, and it doesnt feel flimsy at all, on the contrary it feels rather tough.All in All I bought this so I did not have to buy another TV and Assuming that it keeps working I will be Happy. Keep on Keepin On

Reviews.Title: HVR-950Q - by personal experience
Reviews.Author: Yu Chia Liu "Andre Liu"
Reviews.Content: Basically, this review will be more like any other old reviews, but include some personal experience.1) Installation: you need the latest driver to promise this tv tuner working well.  Also, if you want to watch TV via Windows Media Center, you need a kit, which can  be downloaded from official website. Plus, there is one problem which bothers me a  lot.  I cannot remove it safely by clicking on the small icon on the right bottom in the  notification area, but I just unplug it anyway. Well, this tuner is still working  fine, but I dont know if my action will cause any problem to this tv tuner or not.2) Poor Official Software Provided by Manufacturer: WinTv crashes when I change  channels too fast, and this bothers me a lot. Finally, I watch tv via Windows  Media Center all the time.3) Signal Catching: Strength of signal bases on individual's location. Sadly,  sometimes I have to move antenna to try to find a better place for watching some  specific channels, even CBS for Sunday footbal. There is one more thing, found  channels via Windows Media Center are not as many as those via WinTV. I dont know  why, but it just happens to me. Plus, antenna included in the box is a basic one,  maybe you can buy a better one to replace it.4) Acces: The remote control sucks. That's it. Too small to be hold in an adult's  hand.Overall, this item is good for its price, but not perfect.

Reviews.Title: Pretty trouble free use so far
Reviews.Author: Mark Tee
Reviews.Content: Initial setup was pretty straightforward on Windows Vista 64 bit and Vista 32 bit machines.  TW basic cable and OTH digital work as expected.  Only complaint is with the software updates. Be sure to hang on to the included CD as you will need to have it in the drive to install updates.  I'm not real sure why - it's as if they're afraid someone's going to bootleg the software.Some earlier updates also seemed to have had a negative impact on the software's stability, but the latest version seems pretty solid.  It's also hard to find this particular model on the manufacturer's support web site.  It took a little digging (Google searching) to find it.This serves as our only television and gets used most days and we haven't had any serious problems.  I would recommend it and would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Works as expected
Reviews.Author: Ravi Gupta "Ravi325"
Reviews.Content: The USB tuner is perfect for what I needed - to connect our external antenna to the home theater PC.  Works very well.  The only down side is the WIN TV 7.0 application that comes with it has an upgrade that you have to pay extra for. The upgrade gives you ability to pull TV guide for off the air channels.

Reviews.Title: HVR-950Q TV Tuner
Reviews.Author: Roy
Reviews.Content: Easy to install and use.  I have not had any problems.  I am not using the software that came with the unit.  Media Center uses it just fine as is and I get regular and Quam channels on my cable service.

Reviews.Title: Easy install, works great as a 2nd HD tuner in Xp MCE2005
Reviews.Author: jeffhoward001
Reviews.Content: Overall, I gave this four stars since it really achieve exactly what I was looking for - a plug-n-play 2nd HD tuner for over-the-air HD recording.  Now I can record 2x HD programs at the same time.I went with the USB model since I was out of PCI slots in my Media Center server.  I believe this is my only gripe with this product.  My other tuner is a PCI Pinnacle PCTV HD 800i.  When it's recording HD, my server consumes about 5% CPU usage.  When the Hauppauge HVR-950Q is recording HD, my server averages 30-40% CPU.For me, it's not that big of a deal since my video card supports complete MPEG2 off-loading(acceleration), meaning that when I'm watching an HD show, it uses less than 5% CPU. But this is a buyer-beware that if you don't have an MPEG2 accelerated video card, you may not be able to record a show while watching a previously recorded show at the same time (or the playback may be a little choppy).  If you have an old'ish PC for your Media Center, I'd recommend 2x PCI tuner cards, or a 1x PCI-e dual-tuner (one card with 2x built-in tuners).If you just recording single shows, or watching live HD on a laptop, you'll be happy with this product.- Jeff

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge HVR-950Q TV Tuner
Reviews.Author: Mikey
Reviews.Content: Pretty easy to install.  Works well with Windows 7's media center but when changing channels there seems to be a bit of a lag which is why I gave it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: won't install
Reviews.Author: Aaron T. Deacon
Reviews.Content: This product will not install properly.  The drivers available on the cd do not work and will usually time out and freeze your computer.  And even it it completes the devices shown in the Device Manager of your computer show they were not able to be loaded properly.  Furthermore the 'updated' drivers available on the Hauppauge website do not work either.  In addition if you add the device to a Google search to search the tech forums, you see that this problem is widespread with no solutions.  I am not sure where any positive reviews for this product are coming from because no one seems to make this product work.

Reviews.Title: BIG DISSAPOINTMENT
Reviews.Author: J. Martin
Reviews.Content: We just bought a "power house" running Winders 7 premium 64-bit.  Since this machine will have "everything" I will ever need, I decided to add on a USB TV tuner.  I did some checking and this USB TV Tuner looked pretty spiffy. It even comes with a very small antenna that picks up stuff, but not very good.  Most of the digital channels are pixilated and it can't/won't pick up some of our favorite channels.I'm 21 miles from the Phoenix antenna farm on top of South Mountain.  I can see the antenna farm from my roof, and have an antenna on the roof that picks up 47 crystal clear channels.  The signal strength meters for all these channels on my other two digital TV's are pegged.With the small, included antenna, it finds some of the stations, but can't receive most of them and I'm not sure why.No problem, I'll just connect the antenna on my roof to the tuner and run setup (Windows 7 Media Center) with a new antenna.BIG DISSAPOINTMENT - This tuner, with my external roof antenna, only found 4 channels.I've tried running setup several times, with no success.  I've ran setup with their crappy little antenna, and then switched to my external antenna, with no success.  For some reason, this tuner can not use my external antenna, which I never dreamed would be a problem.  I've contacted Hauppauge but have not received a response.If you are close to the broadcast source, the small included antenna might work ok, however, my recommendation would be to try something else, especially since an external antenna source won't work.  We DO NOT have cable or satellite services, just a nice big antenna on top of the house, so I can't respond on how well this works with other signal sources.

Reviews.Title: Good Bye Cable
Reviews.Author: Hakim M. Aziz
Reviews.Content: I just received this Hauppauge TV Tuner 07/30/2010 and installed it on 3 computers. My two desktops are running Win XP SP3 and my HP Laptop is running Vista Home Premium. Installation was flawless on all three computers and the channel download went smooth also. I have access to all my local TV networks in HD and I can access about 8 other stations, some in HD and others that are not. I keep the antennae that came with the device plugged in so I can't tell you how the device would work without it. I bought this device because I thought it was absolutely insane to have to continue paying $40.00 per month to a cable company when all I really wanted were my network stations. This device has exceeded all of my expectations because not only can I watch all of my favorite shows (mostly news) but I can also record them for viewing later. I'm watching 60 Minutes on my laptop right now while I'm typing this review and the picture couldn't be more perfect. I can't find the software that came with the device on my laptop but HP Media Smart and Windows Media software work just fine. I can't comment on the remote because I haven't needed it thus far. Free delivery took exceedingly long (about a week) but it was worth it. I would highly recommend this device.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievably easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Sysmg
Reviews.Content: There are probably hundreds of different PC configurations that people use with this tuner card.  I built a machine from scratch for this.  It's a P4 3.4Ghz, 2GB Ram, 500GB WD Caviar Blue 7200rpm disk, an ATI Radeon x300 video card, and Windows 7 ultimate.  These tuner cards need a good hardware and software platform to work well.My hardware is probably just adequate.  99% of the time video is as smooth as silk, sometimes it's slightly jumpy.  But Windows 7 seems to make everything incredibly easy.  To install I merely plugged the tuner into my rooftop antenna and then into a USB 2.0 port.  Windows found all the drivers.  I use Windows Media Center so I did not install the software on the CD.  I did however find the IR32 folder on the CD and run IR32.EXE to install the driver for the remote control (which doesn't work until after you run this).  I followed the instructions on the Hauppauge website to set up Windows Media Center.  Once that was done it was easy to watch/record TV using the HVR 950Q.TV quality is great.  Channels change quickly.  The remote has a skip forward 30 seconds button (and a skip back 5 seconds button for when you overshoot the commercials) which works instantaneously.  The remote is a little small, but works reasonably well (you could store it in your laptop PC Card slot).So for my configuration this product has been great.

Reviews.Title: Not Overly Impressed
Reviews.Author: giacog
Reviews.Content: Installation is simple! Just plug it in to the USB port but device configuration is complicated and difficult for  the average user. So after installing the tuner, you need to have patience. My daughter followed the instructions and could not get it to find any TV channels. So I tried and also had the same problem. Four to five attempts later I was finally able to get the channels to tune. Once operational, the tuner would sometimes stop or freeze and requires a software restart to get the picture to come in again. The remote is cheaply made and if not pointing it directly at the tuner, you cannot really use it.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV tuner
Reviews.Author: J. C. Tormos "Time Fanatic"
Reviews.Content: Works as advertsed. I had a little problem with my PC during install but once installed digital quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Secret to install
Reviews.Author: No longer frustrated
Reviews.Content: This tuner finally works well for me.  Had major issues getting it installed.  I recommend a few tips to avoid install problems.  First, use the latest drivers and software from the Hauppauge website, not the software on the CD.  Second, REMOVE ANY PREVIOUS TV TUNER PRODUCTS COMPLETELY FROM YOUR MACHINE.  I had a pvr-150 that I had left in just in case I couldnt get the 950q to work.  No matter how I tried to install the q it would not work correctly until I completely removed all hardware and software related to the pvr-150.  There is a program hwclear on the CD that does a good job of getting rid of previous installs but unless you actually remove the older hardware you cannot get a clean install.  After resolving the install problems I can get both QAM and analog cable channels and the wintv app is useable instead of a bug bomb.  They just need to add back the ability to adjust brightness, contrast etc... and this will be a nice upgrade from my old card which allows me to not only view HD on my pc but is portable to the laptop as well.BTW..others have had luck using Windows MC instead of wintv but for me MCE doesnt want to recognize the tuner.  Just as well since Im not a fan of MC. Hauppauge support was very good, tech is the one that suggested previous installs may be causing the issues I had.  After the major headaches this is a nice product, as other reviews will attest, this guy does run hot but hasnt created any issues for me at this point.

Reviews.Title: Cool device, works for me.
Reviews.Author: Gary, Minneapolis
Reviews.Content: I just needed to have tv on my computer so I purchased this device. It works great and is easy to setup and use. I prefer the Windows Media Center to the Win TV software that comes with it but the quality of the device is solid. I do not like the remote control and do not use it. I do like the fact that you can hook up a camera directly to the device but not sure how useful that will be. Overall a great product and am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: hauppauge wintv tuner
Reviews.Author: Donald Mccracken "DM18265"
Reviews.Content: this tuner was easy to install but was not the best quality ---- picture had static and frames would freeze often (could be driver or wintv app) as it was running on dual core system with 2G of ram & lots of disk space.

Reviews.Title: Great HD tuner stick, clear-qam on cable - found nearly 100 channels.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "gadget freque"
Reviews.Content: Works well on my win xp system.- Has a little remote control, but you have to very carefully position the 950Q for it to work well.- The scheduler won't run while wintv is running and showing a picture, you have to exit for some reason- Found over 100 channels in clear-qam in my cable scan.- It's tedious to assign names like "BRAVO" to a channel found, you have to enter them one at a time with a lot of clicking - a spread-sheet like interface would be MUCH better- I thought it was MAC compatable, but didn't see any MAC software with the unit.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tuner, software has some flaws
Reviews.Author: Kangmin Xu "Frank Xu"
Reviews.Content: The product works not so well with embedded software WinTV, but excellent with Windows Media Center. It is very convenient to record TV in scheduled time.The remoter is kinda small but works well.

Reviews.Title: Works well on Window 7 64bit WMC
Reviews.Author: Arun
Reviews.Content: I was paying around fifteen dollars per month just for renting the HD DVR from comcast. So I decided to put my desktop (which was collecting dust) to good use by connecting two of these tuners and record HD shows on the PC using Windows Media Center. I've an XBOX 360, so I use the media center extender functionality to stream the recorded shows and watch it directly on my TV (over wired ethernet connection). Everything worked flawlessly till now and I am happy that I got rid of the comcast DVR. There's no problem with recording two HD shows simulataneously (with 2 tuners, ofcourse) on my 4 yr old desktop.

Reviews.Title: Not powerfull enough for HDTV - bad OTA tuner
Reviews.Content: This is a utility device, its not reliable for HTPC.Tried the USB card with a Core2 duo laptop plug into a 52' HDTV with an HDMI cable. The laptop was set to output full 1080P resolution on the TV and has a pretty decent Nivia graphic card that can play Blue Rays or full 1080P and 1080P .mkv files.Installation: Went fine with the include CD.WinTV software : Its very basic, but its the only thing that worked. I was unable to configure the device to work with MMC or SageTv.OTA HDTV TUNER: I plug my ClearStream 4 antenna cable into the device. The channel scan didnt pick up all channels. This is because it just wont pick-up any HD channel that is below 5/10 bars of signal strengh when I plug the antenna directly in my TV. So the tuner is pretty bad, maybe its limited by the power it can get from the USB port. So it will only pick up digital channels with very high signal strengh.Live OTA HDTV : The card just cant output a 1080i channel in full HD. Its dropping frames all the time. I tried setting my PC resolution to 720p, but it was still dropping frames. 480i digital channel played fine.PVR : I tried to record something with WinTV. Strangly, there was no frame drops when playing the recorded file.Remote : The remote didnt work at all. Good thing my Logitech Harmony remote control did. Its setup has a Microsoft Media center remote.Botton line : This a utility TV tuner that cant be reliably used has a primary source for a HDTV.

Reviews.Title: nice product
Reviews.Author: Parris W. Higgs "pwilly"
Reviews.Content: the item shipped promptly. i had a little trouble installing but was helped by tech support. I am satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great reception
Reviews.Author: B. Wagner
Reviews.Content: 950Q is a solid tv tuner and recording device. I use it for broadcast tv and the included mini antenna picked up almost all the channels that my larger antenna did. The device allows you to plug in any antenna or cable TV source. HD quality on the computer is great. Compared to PCI devices, this USB one obviously can be switched between computers or used with a laptop at home or on the go. 950Q does not have hardware MPEG2 encoding like others (most PCI and HDPVR) though, which means recording action sports in HD, for example, may suffer. I bought this mainly to time-shift NFL games, and the record quality is a little disappointing (quick camera pans on a pass play are mostly lost to blur and slow encoding). Watching live football does not produce the same problems, ie. blur, dropped frames. And no other shows I've seen so far do it either.950Q does all software encoding. So the speed of your computer may determine your ability to record and watch shows happily. The new Wintv 7 works well on XP. But, when watching recorded shows, it is a resource hog compared to VLC player for example. Despite its flaws (occasional crashes, cpu usage) Wintv works well to schedule recordings and record in the background. The Wintv scheduler works great with [...] program guide. Go on the website, click on your show, click 'record' and it downloads a tvpi file which is automatically recognized by Wintv and the record schedule is set. Call it two-click recording. Or go into Wintv and schedule the old-fashioned way: channel, time, date. Also set it up to record every day/week.950Q also works through Windows Media Center, without the Wintv program. I would like to try that, but have not yet. Media Center offers some added features, such as options to control the file size/quality of recordings. Wintv doesn't do that. Wintv also doesn't have a video library to organize video files, which Media Center does, I believe.Bottom line: if you want to watch TV on the computer, this thing works great. If you're serious about recording HD shows, you may consider the built-in PCI devices or the HD-PVR, which have dedicated encoding chips to get the best resolution. Also Hauppauge makes PCI devices that allow you to record two channels at once, (or watch one, record another) if you are really serious and have no tv.(Computer disclaimer: the video problems I encountered were on a newer AMD X2 chip, 2GB ram, integrated video chip. Not an old machine, or cutting-edge quad core. Maybe a discrete display card would eliminate problems.)

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, good for the $
Reviews.Author: Michael Brown
Reviews.Content: This was an easy device to install.  The picture on mine isnt the best, but that may be b/cI use an AFN anteena.  I had a little trouble with setting up the type of signal I was receiving, but other than that, setup and installation was a breeze.  I would recomend this for someone who wanted an easy way to get another TV out of a computer.  Picture quality isnt as good as a flat screen TV, but its good.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge WinTV TV Tuner
Reviews.Author: Timothy Baggerly "T-Baggs"
Reviews.Content: I am military looking to pull a tv signal from my billiting room and push it into my laptop (Toshiba Satellite P305 running Windows Vista); this Tuner was EXACTLY what I hoped it would be. Not only does the organic tuner -- WinTV -- work well, but it also plays on Windows Media Center which has been an added bonus to record favorite shows.The remote is a bit cumbersome but is a nice added feature.  Overall, this is a very good product for someone on the road with access to TV cable...

Reviews.Title: well done
Reviews.Author: Billy W. Kiggins
Reviews.Content: Very easy install, works perfectly, viewer software included very good .  Hey it does exactly as advertised . I installed 3 months ago no problems .  Thanks ----  Billy

Reviews.Title: unstable but when it works its a joy to behold
Reviews.Author: Raymond Patrick "ray"
Reviews.Content: This certified product crashes my new gateway vista laptop frequently. I try to tiptoe around the pitfalls and not do things that have caused crashes, but I haven't found the right combination yet.The main problems.If you use it with window media center it may crash when starting live viewing or when recording. The same thing happens with the hauppauge application as well, but it's slower and less user friendly.Even when you restart windows it may still crash until after the 2nd or 3rd try. Then it may work for a while only to go down in flames when you think you have it figured out.It reminds me of a lot of the early products on windows like scanners, cd players, midi devices which were very unstable.Why do I put up with it.When it works it's a joy. Thats what life must be like in apple land. The picture is crystal clear. The utilities to find and schedule programs are easy to use.
