Once recorded the program information is saved along with the show title for easy retrieval of shows.I prefer media center to the hauppauge apps, but what I'd really prefer is stable device so I wouldn't have to be concerned about missing a recording or crashing the system. By the way I thought being windows certified meant that it wouldn't crash the operating system.The final reason I put up with it is that I'm on the road a lot and it is very convenient to watch live and recorded video.I have a mod 1 slingbox which works just fine, but the picture quality doesn't compare. It is a good fallback though, and is useful in internet only areas like hotels and airports.The video playback doesn't have any problems, just the record and live tv functions. You do pay a price for the high video quality. It chews up disk space at about 4 gb per hour of recording.One neat feature is you can record and playback a show at the same time. Great for sports since you can skip commercials and replay key events and still not need to be glued to the set for fear of missing something. You don't have to wait until it's done recording to use features like fast forward and rewind and you can stop watching and get back to it at another time.

Reviews.Title: Same ol sam ol
Reviews.Author: Jerry Halasz
Reviews.Content: As with all the Hauppauge items I own... the hardware works just fine. The included software is garbage. The timer software couldn't be worse, you would be better off paying your neighbors kid to come over and hit record than spending hours of your precious time trying to figure this worthless software out.

Reviews.Title: Great Product; Easy to Set Up; Highly Recommended
Reviews.Author: Oscar Levant "Bruce T"
Reviews.Content: It's always hard to make a choice on items where reviews are clearly divided, but I took a chance on this USB TV tuner and was not disappointed.  I wanted to watch broadcast television in my office and since analog signals are going away, I choose the Hauppauge WinTV tuner.  Instructions were easy, installation was a breeze and I was up and running in less than 30 minutes.  I took the supplied antenna and placed it near a window.  The scan produced over 20 digital stations here in the Los Angeles area.  Controls are easy and intuitive and the picture was much more than I expected, almost as good as my Sony HDTV at home.I am certainly happy with this little device and for the price you won't believe what it can do.  I give it my highest recommendations.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Leenaud "leenaud"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Picture is excellentCons: Software is pathetic  Audio is very weak  The software will do the searching for channels. No way that I  know of to manually add channels(analog) even if they have only a  weak signal.  Tuner is getting kind of hot after a while which will probably  shorten the life span of the item.General Comments:I use the tuner with an antennaTo resolve the audio problem I hooked the tuner up to an analog/digital converter box. For some reason that improved the audio by 100%. One should not have to do that but hey, it works. The only problem is that in order to get the converter box configured I need to set the tuner to channel 3 or 4. Well, if the tuner does not detect a signal for channel 3/4 you're out of luck because as I stated before, there is no way to manually add a channel.The software is a joke and stops responding often.I've try to make it work with WMC but that gets me a lot less channels.My notebook is borderline as far as system requirements but I have not noticed any video problems. Even recording programs works well. But, the software does not give the ability to schedule a recording, so one should NOT forget to stop the recording, becaue it fuills up the harddrive quickly.To sum it up, try to work around the WINTV software by either using WMC or a converter box.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it sounds
Reviews.Author: W. Kerr
Reviews.Content: This product worked well on analog cable (NTSC) and digital HD from an antenna, but that is not what I wanted.I purchased this because it was advertised to receive Clear QUAM on cable.  Clear QUAM is a well kept seceret where lots of HD digital channels are unscrambled and available for free via cable.  My Slingbox PRO-HD gets more than 30 channels with at least 10 in HD.  I pay for digital cable from Comcast and use their converter box on my main HDTV.The HVR-950Q did not work in this mode out of the box.  Tech support said they were having problems with Comcast cable and gave me a link to a software patch.  That didn't work either.  Their website had WinTV7 which kind of worked, but the channel numbers were something obscure and I had to guess which channels is which program.  The slingbox lets me tune to over-the-air channel numbers which make sense, but not HVR-950Q.  I keep looking for software updates from Hauppauge but none of them made this mode work.I now have it kind of working on a Windows Vista desktop with the obscure channel numbers.  It sometimes crashes where the video interface disappears.  It sometimes fails to recognize the USB unit and I need to unplug the HVR-950Q and plug it in again to get my computer to see it.I have not been able to get it working on a Windows XP Pro laptop.  It only finds two channels -- one a shopping network and the other in Spanish.

Reviews.Title: Love the tuner.  The remote, not so much...
Reviews.Author: Jaedong
Reviews.Content: Tuner is easy to set up and is very clear using a cable hookup.  I have not used the supplied antenna though.  4 stars because the remote is pretty awful.  Impossible to use in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Runs hot
Reviews.Author: John H. Bush
Reviews.Content: The unit does pick up the usual tv channels but after running over 2 hours the usb tuner gets hot & several of the tv channels scramble. Unplug it, cool it down,& its works for another 2 hours. Not so good.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge WinTV-950Q
Reviews.Author: RC of Houston
Reviews.Content: Great Product. Picked up clear QAM channels with the software provided. Windows Media Center compatible but windows media center does not work with digital channels. You are only going to get analog channels with media center. Watching TV with the software that came with the product is not as clear as with media center. Media center is better when watching analog signals.

Reviews.Title: One day into ownership, this is a fabulous device
Reviews.Author: Erin Thompson
Reviews.Content: Less is certainly more in the case of this excellent TV tuner setup. Yesterday I received the unit (which consists of the USB tuner stick, a short USB extension cable [approximately 6 inches], an extendable antenna connected to a length of coax cable [maybe 3 feet in length], the wafer-thin remote control, a battery for the remote, and an installation disk). I plugged in my laptop (Thinkpad T400s- 4 GB RAM, 2.4 GHz C2D processor, integrated graphics, Windows 7) to AC power, and opted NOT to use the bundled software. Nor did I download anything from the Hauppauge site. Instead, I simply connected the tuner stick to my computer and let it automatically install the drivers needed.I live in a house where the OTA digital signal is extremely poor. It took about 20 minutes to do the initial scan. I was surprised when this little tuner did a better job than my TV at pulling down available channels. Viewing material in Windows Media Center is a simple affair, and the TV guide is efficient and practical. The fact that the antenna needs no amplification makes this the ideal situation for me, since I don't need to carry an additional power brick.Today I viewed television in a location with much better reception than at my house and was blown away by how smoothly material plays. I originally was prompted to buy this unit because I will be away from the TV for the Superbowl this year and want to be able to catch some of it. This will certainly do the trick and I expect will serve me admirably well into the future. I consider this money very well spent.

Reviews.Title: Big disappointment
Reviews.Author: C. B. Edison
Reviews.Content: This was a big disappointment.  First, I got this for a netbook, as the other review I read indicated it would work.  It did not - on a netbook with theexact same processor, set to full battery and highest performance,ect, it still stutters and lags constantly.  The software is really bad, andfrequently locks up and crashes.I did see on the box (but nowhere here on Amazon) that it requires a 2.2GHz processor, so I decided to try to salvage it and use it on my desktop pc, a2.66GHz Dual Core.  It still lags and stutters on most channels, still freezes anywhere from 5 to 20 seconds as I try to change channels and it buffers. Figured that the antenna might be too weak and plugged the cable direct from the cable box into it, and while it worked and put the cable channel ontomy pc, it still stuttered and was very sub-par.

Reviews.Title: Works great with Windows Media Center.
Reviews.Author: Kirk
Reviews.Content: Use Windows Media Center and you'll be happy with this tuner. If you use the TV software that comes with the tuner then you will be frustrated.Asus makes a tuner stick that works equally as well and may be cheaper than this one, but also should be used with Windows Media Center as its software is not so good either.

Reviews.Title: Not powerfull enough for HDTV - bad OTA tuner
Reviews.Content: This is a utility device, its not reliable for HTPC.Tried the USB card with a Core2 duo laptop plug into a 52' HDTV with an HDMI cable. The laptop was set to output full 1080P resolution on the TV and has a pretty decent Nivia graphic card that can play Blue Rays or full 1080P and 1080P .mkv files.Installation: Went fine with the include CD.WinTV software : Its very basic, but its the only thing that worked. I was unable to configure the device to work with MMC or SageTv.OTA HDTV TUNER: I plug my ClearStream 4 antenna cable into the device. The channel scan didnt pick up all channels. This is because it just wont pick-up any HD channel that is below 5/10 bars of signal strengh when I plug the antenna directly in my TV. So the tuner is pretty bad, maybe its limited by the power it can get from the USB port. So it will only pick up digital channels with very high signal strengh.Live OTA HDTV : The card just cant output a 1080i channel in full HD. Its dropping frames all the time. I tried setting my PC resolution to 720p, but it was still dropping frames. 480i digital channel played fine.PVR : I tried to record something with WinTV. Strangly, there was no frame drops when playing the recorded file.Remote : The remote didnt work at all. Good thing my Logitech Harmony remote control did. Its setup has a Microsoft Media center remote.Botton line : This a utility TV tuner that cant be reliably used has a primary source for a HDTV.

Reviews.Title: OTA HDTV recorded and transfered to Tivo = beautiful
Reviews.Author: Thomas D. Jones "loves music"
Reviews.Content: I bought this with the intent of recording Hi-def shows over-the-air and play them back on my Tivo Series 3. All I can say is WOW! It works like a charm. I live in the Austin Texas area about 20 miles from the television transmitters and I pick up all of the main HD stations coming out of Austin. I wanted to be able to record an HD program and have it available for viewing on my Tivo in Hi-def, this worked like a charm. Easy to install, you just plug the thing into a USB port and install the software. I installed this on my desktop PC, not laptop. I was skeptical at first, while watching some HD programs on my PC the video was jerky. I decided to record something for 30 minutes and see what it looked like on the Tivo and it was awesome. You need the Tivo Desktop Plus software version 2.6.2 for this to work. I also used a "rabbit ear" antenna instead of the one that came with the tuner, that may have helped.All in all, I like this tuner. BTW, my Series 3 Tivo can record 2 Hi-def programs at the same time. The reason I was looking for this solution is that my local cable company, Suddenlink, does not carry the CW network in Hi-def. The local affiliate broadcasts OTA HD, so now I can watch "Smallville" and "Supernatural" in HD, take that Time Warner!!

Reviews.Title: Hit or Miss
Reviews.Author: Lexy Bourne
Reviews.Content: I bought this tuner and had many of the same issues that others mention in the reviews. I returned it and ended up buying a PCI-E card from Hauppauge that works great. But that isn't very helpful if you're wanting something for a laptop...Based on the reviews on Amazon alone, it sounds to me that it's hit or miss with this tuner. It either works or it doesn't. People who get a working one seem to be happy. On the flipside, sounds like Hauppauge is sending out a lot of lemons... apparently their quality control is as good as their customer service. For anyone considering buying this product, I would suggest making sure to buy from a reputable retailer where you can return for a full refund and without return fees if yours doesn't work. I'd also only purchase knowing there's a good chance it won't work and don't spend too much time trying to troubleshoot if you can't get it to work. Based on others reviews, it will either work out of the box, or it won't work at all.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed - Could only receive 1 Digital Channel
Reviews.Author: HJS3
Reviews.Content: Played with this for 2 weeks, at different locations, 1 channel is not worth it.  If all you want is a DVR, you can plug this into you cable service, but as for off the air - forget it...

Reviews.Title: Tuner & Remote
Reviews.Author: Benchrest
Reviews.Content: I'm running Windows 8 Pro. The device is compatible. Software for tuner was easy to install, no problems. Picture is great, tuner works exactly as advertised. Only negative is the remote. Did not work at all. I wasted a few dollars on 2 new batteries; no help. Remote still doesn't work. The tuner does NOT work with Windows Media Center. I've tried numerous times booting Media Center and the program does not recognize the tuner. For the money the tuner is a good buy!

Reviews.Title: I'm sure it works if you can even install it.
Reviews.Author: L. Minh
Reviews.Content: My specs on my new laptop are basically: Windows 7 64b OS, 6 GB ram, Core i5 processor. I couldn't install the drivers for this, from the disk or the downloaded file from the website. It continued to say that the driver was incompatible with my system. I bought this at Best Buy and returned it. Maybe it works for some, but it didn't with me.

Reviews.Title: Watch out for defective items
Reviews.Author: Andres
Reviews.Content: Perhaps disappointing but this item turned out defective from start. It heats up to a finger touch and the led light is off. It is supposed to update features of the TV-HVR 850 and I cannot establish difference at all. I place it on the loss column of my record keeping routine.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: William Paul Shields
Reviews.Content: Never worked right from the start...now after 6 mos tried it again and it don't work at all. no led lights come on...nothing....garbage, save your money

Reviews.Title: Great solution for live TV on my PC, especially with Windows Media Center
Reviews.Author: Will Klinger
Reviews.Content: After considering an internal TV tuner card, I settled on this Hauppauge USB tuner because I didn't want to have to take apart my PC. The main reason I wanted live TV on my computer is so I could watch the news in the morning while I surfed the web. Installation literally couldn't be easier. You simply plug in the device to an available USB port and then attach either the included antenna or a cable connection. Windows 7 instantly recognized the device and it took less than a minute to download and install the drivers.That's not to say I didn't run in to a few problems during the setup process, however any issues were on my end and not any fault of the product. A few notes that might help potential buyers:-I briefly tried the tuner with the included antenna, but couldn't really pick up any of the channels. Even if I could have, it only would have been local over-the-air broadcast networks (NBC, ABC, FOX, etc.).-My computer desk is located on the same wall as my internet/cable jack, so I simply had to use a 3-way splitter: one cable to my modem and one cable to the tuner device. I haven't noticed any degradation in my internet speed.-I have not installed the included WinTV software. From what I've read, it tends to be buggy. Instead, I am using Windows Media Center, which was included on my PC when I purchased it. After plugging in the tuner, I simply ran the set-up wizard in Windows Media Center and before long I was watching live TV.  Media Center also has a rewind/pause feature and lets you record live TV, just like the included software. Why not use something that's already installed and integrated with your machine?-At first, the signal had quite a bit of interference. This was fixed by swapping out one of the cables for another one. I don't know anything about different types of coax cables, but switching at least one of them seemed to fix the problem.-Because I'm already a cable subscriber, the jacks in my house were all activated with basic cable. This means that in addition to all the local networks (some of which are in HD and look fantastic), I get about 50 or so basic cable channels. None of the cable channels are in HD, so they aren't widescreen or crystal clear, but they still look great and are watchable. You can attach a regular TV to the jack that the tuner will use to see what channels you are supposed to be getting.Finally, I'll add that I'm using the tuner with a pretty fast machine with plenty of juice: Windows 7 64-bit with an Intel i7 processor and 8GB of RAM, and an ATI Radeon HD 5670 graphics card. I get the sense that less powerful machines would be able to handle this tuner just fine, but you still probably need a decent processor to handle the extra load.

Reviews.Title: Good product - would be better with some software improvements
Reviews.Author: Robert N. Goldberg
Reviews.Content: The Hauppauge unit works as advertised.  It conveniently and reliably allows one to record TV programs to the hard drive of one's computer.  However, most folks like to watch TV on their regular TV screen.  Thus, one needs to be able to get the recorded file to one's regular TV.  One way to do this is to burn a DVD and use a DVD player to watch the program.  However, the software provided with the Hauppauge uses a dot ts format.  Thus, one must first convert the dot ts file to a format (i.e., dot mpg) that can be used to burn a DVD.  I was unable to locate a suitable program to do this conversion and Hauppauge was not able to suggest one.  Note:  the Hauppauge software also allows one to record using a dot mpg format - but this recording method is not reliable.  Hopefully, later versions of Hauppauge's software will fix this problem.Another option is to have a means to connect one's computer to one's TV.  This can be done by a direct wire (e.g., HDMI cable) or by using a media interface device.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauqe hvr-9500Q
Reviews.Author: J. Tong "jt"
Reviews.Content: Spend two days with three computers, 2 window 7 and 1 XP, using the latest driver from the website and driver from the supplied disc, not even one work. Returned it to Amazon. Amazon return service was easy and quick giving credit to my account.

Reviews.Title: This item did not work at all for me to get TV in my computer
Reviews.Author: Erwin L. Zerrer
Reviews.Content: I order the item to be able to view television with my computer. Before I ordered it I consulted with the manufacturer's technical support and was informed that with the antenna provided in the kit I should be able to pull local channels.I was not able to pull ANY channels.

Reviews.Title: TV tuner - Bad software
Reviews.Author: Amable Trujillo
Reviews.Content: I could not get its software to work in my computer, because I have another Hauppauge tuner installed, and it would only recognize one. I'm planning on returning it.

Reviews.Title: Portable Digital TV
Reviews.Author: Ride Like the Wind
Reviews.Content: It works! I purchased this as part of a portable multimedia set up for my  ASUS Eee PC 1005HA-PU1X-BU netbook, along with the ASUS protable DVD/CD burner.  With my netbook, this TV tuner and DVD player, I can now watch DVD movies and TV.  This saved me lots of money because I was going to buy a separate portable TV and separate portable DVD player to take with me on the road. This tuner cost me $60 the digital TV that I wanted cost $199. Also, most portable TV are 7" my netbook is 10.1".  And unlike portable TVs, this product can record TV shows for later playback.The channels come in crisp and clear with this TV tuner. Football, baseball (Go Phillies!) look really good on this thing.  It picked up every channel in my area (Philly suburbs)that was on my home television. The antenna that comes with it works better than the rabbit ears that I connected to it.  I almost didn't give the little antenna that comes with it a try, due to the negative reviews.  It actually is a solid antenna, just make sure you extend it fully.NOTE: for anyone using this netbook with the TV tuner, make sure that both the battery configuration as well as the netbook's hard drive performance mode is set to Max battery mode and Super performance mode.  If you have it set to the lower modes, to conserve battery life, you will get choppy sound and picture quality.  Set at maximum quality modes it's like having your own personal size HD TV.  Excellent!

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: S. singh Dhamrhat "Desi"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent quality (when using coax cable), flawless integration with windows media center on my vista laptop, crisp HD picture - very fluid and rich in color.cons: apparent 2 or 4 second 'freeze' moment when changing channels - although this may be with all tv-tuners... i dont know.a very nice unit, overall. i bought a new laptop that has 640gb (2 320gb drives) and i can now use my laptop as a dvr. a really good price plus since happauge makes MOSTLY tv/av related computer components, you know they're good at it.this unit is better than the 'built-in' one offered by the manufacturer. i would definitely reccommend this unit to anyone who wants a usb tv tuner.

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm with Media Center
Reviews.Author: Antonio Grazie "Sound Hound"
Reviews.Content: This is a handy product that is a bit pricey. It is connected to a Windows 7 desktop and operating through the Media Center that does the TV connection and navigation though channels and volume control.  The signal feed is from an outdoor antenna that brings in 45 OTA stations. Operation over time and alternate setup through the provided disc will determine whether or not it earns that fifth star.

Reviews.Title: Not a TV replacement yet
Reviews.Author: Greg D
Reviews.Content: Review of Hauppauge! WinTV-HVR 950Q HYBRID TV STICKThis review is based on my use of the TV adapter on two computers and the supplied antenna and a cable connection on two computers.An old Dell Latitude D running Windows XP and an ASUS Viveotab Smart running Windows 8 (no CD/DVD drive)I am not a computer expert, but I do know my way around them.LOADING THE SOFTWAREI loaded the CD into the Del and followed the directions. The software loaded as expected. I then did the channel scan. The first time the system did not find any signals. I moved the antenna to a better location and I was able to re-scan and find 15 channels.I downloaded the full software package from the Hauppauge web site to the Asus. I then tried to follow the directions on the support site. After two (2) days of trying I finally copied the supplied CD to a thumb drive, then copied that file to the ASUS and was able to load that software. Then I applied the downloaded software. It took three (3) days of frustrating effort to make it work on the ASUS.OPERATING THE DEVICEWhen I started to use the device on the Dell, I was happy with the picture. It looked very good. When I tried to watch the different channels I was dissapointed that many of them would break up very often and were not watchable at all.  I do understand that this may be due to poor reception of the antenna. Once I found the channel I did want to watch and I was getting a good receipiton, I was not getting ANY sound. I called the support phone and got excellent service! The problem was a simple fix of selecting the “English” audio stream.For the first half hour or so of watching, the system seemed fine. After that, the picture started to degrade. It began to have part of the screen go black and/or freeze. The longer I watched, the worse the problem became. It was VERY frustrating trying to watch an hour show. If I shut down the program, wait a min & then restart it, I was good for another time period. At some point, the picture would freeze. Also, if I watch full screen, the freeze takes place in less time.Once I had the software loaded on the ASUS, I did a channel scan and on the first try got nothing. So, in an attempt to compare the two systems I set up the Dell and did a scan. The Dell found 15. I then shut down the Dell without moving it AT ALL! I started the ASUS and set it on the keyboard of the Del, unplugged the USB from the Dell and plugged it into the ASUS with NO movement of the antenna at all. The ASUS found three (3) stations!When watching TV with the system, I have the same problem on the ASUS as I did on the Dell. After a time, the picture starts to break up and it will eventually freeze. If I watch full screen, it happens faster.I then used a free computer cleaning program (like CCleaner). One that has run, the system did seem to last a bit longer without freezing up. I have also noticed that if I shut down the program and NOT the computer, then bring the TV program back up it tends to stay stable for a longer time than the first time.Also note, during all of the testing above, when the computer and unit was on, the connection to computer LED was on and green. And, the signal strength LED was green with a few flashes of yellow every so often. All of the testing was with the best station I was receiving.As the old Dell has XP on it that is no longer supported, I removed most programs from it and did the testing one more time. It did work a bit better. Connected to the cable, I DID see all of the channels, but still had the freezing problem. IF I use the cleaner program often, it works better.Another note, as the directions state, you MUST BE CLOSE to the TV transmitter or you get NOTHING!I would say that this device is good for temp use, but NOT, as a TV replacement.Greg

Reviews.Title: Couldn't get supplied software to run
Reviews.Author: W. Rittenhouse
Reviews.Content: My computer is a Dell xps 8700 with last night's big Windows 7 update.  I tried everything I knew but could not  get it to install and setup properly.  Any software that needs the antivirus turned off (I did) is a big, probably ill-conceived, problem. I am likely done with this brand.

Reviews.Title: Was not what expected
Reviews.Author: Thomas D. Dawley "bktdd"
Reviews.Content: First let me note did not try this in a computer.  I used in an WD Live Media player (it was recommended device to give the Media player tuner/DVR capability).  The device was recognized easily by the WD player but once setup tuning was very slow.  Also, even though had tuner hooked up to same antenna the TV had been connected to, I got less channels and quality was intermittent.  Several of the channels that tuned fine on Sony Bravia TV would not pull up using this device.  I tried different cables, new locations for antenna, etc.  Also, tuning was very slow going from one channel to the next.  Due to these issues, I cannot recommend.

Reviews.Title: Ideal DVR option for cable-cutters
Reviews.Author: wordnrrrd
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to convert a 3-year-old HP desktop into a DVR for over-the-air digital TV, and it works exactly as I'd hoped. A few notes:1. Although many Windows computers will automatically download the drivers for this tuner, those drivers will often be out of date. Be sure to download the latest drivers from the Hauppauge website. (If you're using Windows Media Center, it'll hang while trying to find signals if you're using an outdated driver.)2. If you have a computer with Windows Media Center, you won't need the software that comes with this tuner; Windows Media Center automatically detected the card and TV signals (after I updated the drivers), and it's an intuitive, robust program that works like a charm.3. The antenna that comes with this tuner will only suffice if you live in a metropolitan area where all of the broadcast signals generate within a 10-mile radius; the rest of us will need a heftier antenna. The Mohu Leaf is a good option, although I use the ChannelMaster DB8 since many of our local broadcasts generate from 30+ miles away.4. I don't know if the included remote will work with Windows Media Center, but I use the Logitech Wireless Touch Keyboard K400 with Built-In Multi-Touch Touchpad. It's inexpensive, lightweight, small, easy to use, and has a wireless range of 33 feet.With all of that said, this is a good product if you've ditched cable but still want to be able to record your favorite programs. And for the record, my computer is connected to a 720 HDTV via a VGA cable and male-to-male stereo cable. The picture isn't as good as when the coax was plugged directly into the TV, but it's still quite good. If you have the option of connecting your computer and TV via HDMI, the picture should be excellent.

Reviews.Title: doesnt work
Reviews.Author: jjms3216
Reviews.Content: have tried for almot a month to get this to work and doesnt even receive signal total waste of money

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Bassett
Reviews.Content: I added this USB tuner to my Win7 PC that has an internal tuner card.  The configuration was a little challenging, but I think it was a product of how old my internal card is.  I probably could have removed the internal card, added this one, and had it done quite quickly.

Reviews.Title: weak
Reviews.Author: emmapeel "emmapeel"
Reviews.Content: When the weather was perfect, we got decent reception, but the minute any clouds or fog came in overhead, goodbye tuner. (In San Francisco we have lots of fog--you can imagine the problem.)The solution was to get the Hauppauge tuner card for the computer rather than rely on this weak USB tuner. We just installed that today and the reception is a thousand times better (in our heavy fog).I've read online that Hauppauge had poor customer service, but that wasn't my experience. We needed their help with the installation of the tuner card and they were very helpful; we were only on hold for like 30 seconds.

Reviews.Title: Now I can watch Tv.
Reviews.Author: J. Norwood
Reviews.Content: I use windows 8, and the process of installing software was really easy. You do need to keep the cd even if you download the drivers from the internet.Overall the tuner does a great job picking up the clear qam channels from my university provider. But the analog signal is really lousy for some reason.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Walker Power Design Jimmy A Walker
Reviews.Content: I use this with a good outdoor antenna with amplifier and it pulls in the same channels as a TV plus it lets me use the computer as a digital video recorder.  The signal is maintained at its full original quality so it is better than our previous cable or satellite service.

Reviews.Title: Acceptable if, I mean IF, you can configure it correctly.
Reviews.Author: AllThatJazz
Reviews.Content: After several hours of unguided fumbling I arrived at a suitable installation.Step 1.  Throw everything but the stick and usb cord in the trash.Step 2.  Connect hardware.Step 3.  Download and install latest DRIVERS ONLY from Hauppauge.Step 4.  This is clincher,  configure Windows Media Center appropriately.  I was very displeased with the performance until I stumbled into appropriate config using WMC.****** Note *******  Comcast sucks and they are screwing you.  I'm done with Comcast.  They are overpriced and deliver poor quality and poor content.  Every other service delivers superior content and quality.  Think I'm kidding????

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Daniel A. Adams "Crash"
Reviews.Content: I got it last night, unpackaged it, and set out all of the parts.  After setting up the USB (TV) Flash drive dongle, I installed the end of the USB cable into a vacant USB port (they tell you not to put it in a hub) and then set up the drivers and software.  The first time I tried to turn on the TV it didn't work.  I then reloaded the software and it worked find. TV came right on.  It has ports so you can INPUT Composite, S Video and a TV cable.  No outputs.  If you want to watch the TV from your computer on a big Monitor, you need an S video, Composite, HD or other Port on your laptop that can hook up to your monitor or TV.  The scheduler doesn't have the ability to use the codes in the TV guide.  IT is a straight put in the time and duration and channel and that is it.  You have to have your computer on for it to record a program even if you have a recording time schedule.  In other words, it can't start up your computer and then record a program.  I will return to this review as the months progress and add details.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: E. Kenji Kawakami
Reviews.Content: This TV receiver is a nice add-on to my standard PC.  Worked as advertised and I'm pleased with the performance.  The antenna lead wire could be a bit longer to provide more placement flexibility.

Reviews.Title: Does NOT work.  JUNK
Reviews.Author: Markus
Reviews.Content: This thing never really worked like it was supposed to.  my WinTV PCI card from the year 2000 was awesome back then.. but this USB thing is JUNK.  Support... IDK if they speak english.  should i press #1 in my email?!QUOTE:retienne@hauppauge.comMar 10 (2 days ago)to meHello  Sorry to hear that are you using a usb extension with the unit. If you are remove it. Can you try a different usb port that is not usb 3.0 or the color blue. Can you try a different pc. You have a warrantee for 2yrs you did not waste your moneyRudy Etiennerudy@hauppauge.comTechnical SupportHauppauge Computer WorksNew YorkFrom: Mark xx [mailto:markxxxx-@gmail.com]Sent: Friday, March 07, 2014 5:51 PMTo: Support1Subject: WinTV-HVR-950QHi,When I plug in my USB HVR-950Q,  Windows says "USB Device malfunctioned" and "device unrecognizable"Is there any way to fix this thing?  Or did I just waste $80 on an obviously defective by design product?-Mark

Reviews.Title: Not great reception
Reviews.Author: Christopher Rodesch
Reviews.Content: Compared to my tv plugged into the same antenna its a fail. Got 1 channel ok, 1 really bad, the other 10 not at all. Bought a cheap LCD TV with a real tuner and plugged it into my projector instead

Reviews.Title: Works ok
Reviews.Author: Louis A. Torraca
Reviews.Content: So far it has been ok except for one time when I set it and it did not record as scheduled (reason I rate it as 3 stars.) I purchased this one as my other one won't work with win 8.1

Reviews.Title: Excellent hardware, well built and great quality
Reviews.Author: Pedro Jose Miranda Huembes
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, this card is compatible with all Windows 32 and 64 bits from XP to Windows 8 and more

Reviews.Title: Very user friendly;inexpensive HD/DVR
Reviews.Author: Thunderbird
Reviews.Content: I receive tv programs on my HD/TV via ATSC digital over-the-air rooftop antenna. This Hauppauge WinTV receiver has met all my expectations for use as a PC/TV, inexpesive quality DVR, and audio/video source recorder; for Lp's or Tape. The TV tuner can be programmed to record one or multiple scheduled TV shows; and it multi-tasks by recording seamlesssly in the back ground while you're doing other tasks on your PC or watching another channel from the Tuner. Jerry in tech support was super helpful, when I overlooked a step I didn't select during the initial intstallation, with talking me through the remedy on the phone.

Reviews.Title: It Works Great!
Reviews.Author: conjur
Reviews.Content: I bought this device a couple of months ago after my big screen TV went dead. I thought I would use it temporarily until I bought a new TV. Living in semi-rural Oregon, one hundred miles from the City, I didn't expect much, to my surprise it works great, I get several stations in crystal clear hi def on my computer monitor. So I cancelled the Cable, now I am watching the Sochi Olympics for free!

Reviews.Title: Spanish broadcasts?!
Reviews.Author: james michael walter
Reviews.Content: Product works as advertised with one huge exception!  I bought this to watch TV on our projector for the Super Bowl.  Everything was great until kickoff when the broadcast switched to Spanish!!  4 hours of pre-game- English, literally at the kickoff- swithed to Spanish!  Commercials- English!  I was baffled and beside myself.  My wife spent the whole first half trying to figure it out, making sure some setting was off.  Customer service is only available M-F, understandable, but frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Video Unboxing
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Link below for the HD YouTube Video, please like the video if you appreciate it. :)http://youtu.be/-5s11HQlzjcPros;- Works out of box without any drivers needed with Windows 7 SP1- Does not heat up as much as the competition when in use- Sturdy- Easier to use and setup than the competitionCons;- Average quality Antenna- Average quality remote- Price is way out there compared to the competition

Reviews.Title: It did not work long term for me - Returned
Reviews.Author: Brent Dunaway "bnduny"
Reviews.Content: We attempted to use this for two months. At the beginning, it was working ok. Over time however, it stopped working altogether. I tried it on two different computers and various antennas including the one it came with. Its recordings were choppy, if it recorded at all. It never worked more than a few recordings in a row at which point I would have to restart the entire computer to get it to record again. I went online and tried all the settings, defrag, and various solutions I could find there. In the end, I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Easy install
Reviews.Author: Perry & Shirley
Reviews.Content: After reading the directions I was amazed at how installation and user friendliness this item was to set up. Yes, there still remained a learning curve albeit small.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised.
Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised.Easy to install and use.Files are a little large 8.3 Giga Bytes for a 2 hour recoarding

Reviews.Title: Not suitable for linux
Reviews.Author: Randolph H. Murdock III
Reviews.Content: I tried this tuner card due to some reccomendations from other linux users on Amazon.  Unfortunately, it didn't work out of the box.  I downloaded the firmware, and checked it via modprobing... so far, so good.  Mythbuntu recognized it, but it failed to scan any channels, even when trying to scan for just ATSC OTA channels.  I wasn't about to waste a month trying to 'fix' it like I did with the HD Homerun that I had tried before.It may work with some cajoling, but it fails my 'just works' test.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended, despite minor issues
Reviews.Author: Another Floyd
Reviews.Content: This tuner has exceeded my expectations. It's my first experience with a PC tuner, and first experience with Windows Media Center, as well. I was driven to a tuner by my desire for a new big screen TV. For years, I have used a Vizio HDTV for my computer monitor. That TV had a picture-in-picture feature that allowed me to watch TV while doing other computing. None of the current HDTVs offer PIP. This device gives me the functionality I need.I was concerned that the tuner would not be as sensitive as the tuners in my HDTV's, and would not be able to pick up as many channels, via the antenna in my attic. Wrong! It picked up all of my regular channels, as well as a few more. (Only 1 of the extra channels was really watchable; signal on the others was marginal, which may explain why the HDTVs had not registered them.)The installation with Windows 7 Home Premium was simple. Drivers were downloaded and installed automagically, by Windows. I didn't need ANY of the software on the provided disc. The hardest part of the install was finding the invisible menu in Windows Media Center. I had hooked up the tuner, but, because I could not find the menu, I de-installed WMC, rebooted, then reinstalled WMC. That was probably not necessary, but, at least I stumbled into the menu, on the later attempt. The menu walked me nicely through channel registration.There are two things in the packaged install provided on the disc that I wanted in my setup: the signal strength meter, and the software to allow use of the remote control. Although there are no menu items on the install disc to get these individual components, it may be possible to get them installed via disc navigation with Windows file manager. But, I had already seen the two items as available in the support area of Hauppauge's web site, so, I downloaded and installed them.Windows users that do not have WMC will want to install from the disc, to get the WinTV application, which I did not try.Windows Media Center works great. And, it works great with the Hauppauge remote... kinda-sorta. The signal from the remote is very weak, the small gummy buttons (the current remote does not match the product photo on Amazon) are hard to use accurately, and the buttons repeat after a not-very-long press, so, it's easy to  accidentally toggle the mute button on-off-on-off, for example. Another problem with the remote is that there's no dot or dash to use during direct input of over-the-air channels. You can not enter 3.2, so, you can not do direct entry of any OTA channels; you have to use channel up/down, or select from the WMC guide. Also, the Prev Channel button does not work as expected in WMC: it toggles between full screen and window, which is nice to have.So, I set about teaching the tuner's remote functions to my universal remote. Now, I have a sweet, sweet setup. There's one other minor niggle about the remote's functions with WMC. I'm not sure whether Hauppauge or Microsoft is more to blame, and whether there might be a workaround: When WMC is not the active window, it cannot receive channel change or menu functions, while volume controls do continue to work. Since I'm normally working on other applications, the WMC window is usually not the active window. Oh, I JUST found a partial workaround while checking details for this review: the WMC On/Off button on the remote also functions to make WMC the active window. So, if I had been using another program, then set the keyboard/mouse aside, then later want to change channels with the remote, I can hit the power button, then the channel button.The tuner unit is warm, but, not hot. You do have to position the unit with extension cable thoughtfully to receive remote functions, and this makes it a challenge not to have unsightly cables laying all around.I love this tuner, but, will take off one star for the minor annoyances.---2 months later: Well, the remote functions were nice, but, they died. No, there's nothing wrong with my universal remote, nor the one that came with the tuner. But, the IR receiver in the tuner seems to have gradually died. In the beginning, a few functions stopped working, or became inconsistent. Reboot, or stop and restart of the IR software sometimes fixed it. Now, all remote functions are gone. I have new appreciation for keyboards with media buttons. Also, I have become aware of keyboard shortcuts for Windows Media Center; all functions you would control with a remote can be controlled by a standard keyboard. For the remote problem, I'd have to downgrade the tuner by half a star.

Reviews.Title: Good Quality
Reviews.Author: tawin
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use.The quality of file which is recorded from TV is good.ATSC and NTSC are both worked.Can be used in Ubuntu 12.04

Reviews.Title: Best tuner
Reviews.Author: G. Steelman
Reviews.Content: Hauppauge makes a great product, it does what it claims.  Easy to set up and start using.  I would purchase this again.

Reviews.Title: Good Unit
Reviews.Author: Fil Dennis
Reviews.Content: Just what I expected from Hauppauge... a very good item. I've been buying TV tuner since Windows 95 from Hauppauge and they all have work great. Keep up the good work Hauppauge!

Reviews.Title: Worked great for a couple months and then stopped working
Reviews.Author: Stacey Niebruegge
Reviews.Content: It worked great for a couple months and then just stopped working.  It seems like the product is just too sensitive.  When we weren't using it, we just stored it in a drawer.  Now when you connect it to the USB port on the computer, it doesn't do anything.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge TV Tuner does WIndows, but doesn't do wine!
Reviews.Author: Inspector Gadget
Reviews.Content: Great tv tuner, but I am unable to get it to work under Linux as some others had stated before.  But its not necessarily the manufacturer's fault.  Its us people that love to hate on Microsoft that are apparently the problem.

Reviews.Title: I hate the new model. I regret buying it.
Reviews.Author: Calvin Carter
Reviews.Content: Horrible! I used to own the WinTV-HVR-950 (not Q) and it worked like a charm for 5 years and it just broke recently. I ordered their latest model and it worked for about a month. Now I can't even watch TV. My computer is capable of supporting the 950Q, but I still can't figure out whats wrong with this thing! I definitely am regretting spending $85 on this thing. I should have just bought myself a TV

Reviews.Title: Seems to have a high learning curve.
Reviews.Author: Tom Niedererr
Reviews.Content: I haven't really completely installed it yet and have not recorded anything. It seems to have a sharp learning curve. Of course that could be me. I'm not really a computer guru.

Reviews.Title: Work well on m window 7 PC
Reviews.Author: V. Wu
Reviews.Content: Work well and had it for over 2+ years.Just download the latest software from its web site to make sure it works.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge to the rescue!!!
Reviews.Author: Edward A. Jussely
Reviews.Content: I subscribed to Dish which has no contract with the local CBS affiliate.  Hauppauge's device allows me to use my computer as an alternate DVR to record or see live CBS programming that I would otherwise miss.  My den is set up in such a way that the computer is in one corner and the flat screen is diagonally across the room.  I can watch two football games at once using this device to pick up over-the-air signals while watching cable sports networks on the flat screen.  I can record local over-the-air programs using this device and play them directly through my computer to the flat screen via a dvd player that pairs with my Windows home network.  If I wanted to put the programming on a DVD, I can use free software to edit out commercials and burn the DVD.  I suppose I could take my laptop to church and watch TV when the sermon gets boring or watch TV in a restaurant or anywhere else.  This device ships with a small antenna but I used the August DTA240 High Gain Digital TV Aerial - Portable Indoor/Outdoor Digital instead.

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: Iris Radner
Reviews.Content: This little gizmo allows our TV to come through the computer screen.  It eliminates one extra item in the kitchen. I appreciated the tech support which was quick, clear and patient.

Reviews.Title: Small device is great for OTA broadcasts.
Reviews.Author: GaryAJUSA "GAJUSA"
Reviews.Content: Great device for pulling Over-The-Air broadcasts.  Local, close stations provide clear reception, some, not so much.  This isn't the device fault.  I use mine with Windows Media Center and on a laptop.  I can take it out-of-town and record ABC/CBS/FOX/NBC stations of a favorite show, like The Mentalist while I'm in a meeting, then watch (time-shift) later.  The high-definition signal makes for good viewing.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Hank
Reviews.Content: Best system i have seen yet for this type of tv programing. Could use some more features but every happy wit it. And works great on my PC. I would highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Good video recording, poor interface.
Reviews.Author: BleedBlue "Matt"
Reviews.Content: I cancelled cable TV a few years ago and have wanted one of these ever since.  I finally spent the money and found it to be a bit of a disappointment.  The user interface looks like RealPlayer circa 2001.  Instead of having menus or buttons you must right click on the video pane to access the programming and video playback screens.The antenna included is fantastic.  It receives as well as my Leaf antenna.  The video looks good on my 55" LED TV.  It has never missed a program.

Reviews.Title: Not a good fit for Linux/MythTV - Possible defective device.
Reviews.Author: K. W. Rudd
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer, I purchased this unit to use with MythTV on a Fedora 19 system.  I could never get it to reliably provide video with either MythTV or Kaffeine.  Kaffeine would see the local ATSC channels, and decode the station information, but would provide no video/audio.  I installed the provided software on a Win7 Pro 64 system to validate whether the HW work with the target OS and SW provided.  Even there, all I was ever able to get was audio for each program (no video).Since it would not work properly even with its provided SW, I returned the unit as defective.In my quick review for other options, I ran across recommendations for the HDHomeRun tuner (SiliconDust HDHomeRun DUAL High Definition Digital TV Tuner HDHR3-US).  I ordered that instead of trying another WinTV-HVR-950Q, and was up and running with MythTV the same day the unit arrived.  The bonus win is that the HDHomeRun is a Dual tuner device, so I can now record two different channels at the same time.If you are looking for a tuner with good multi-OS support, I recommend staying away from the Hauppauge 950Q, and going with something like the HDHomeRun.

Reviews.Title: Excellent portable tuner for Lenovo laptop running Windows 8
Reviews.Author: P. Radloff
Reviews.Content: The Hauppauge works perfectly with my Lenovo laptop running Windows 8.  I called the Hauppauge company for advice about which tuner to purchase and received friendly and competent customer service.  The tuner works perfectly.  Based on reviews, I also decided to purchase Windows Media Center ($100 extra to convert Windows 8 to Windows 8 Pro) and don't regret it.  The tuner has worked seamlessly and easily with Windows Media Center.  Per Hauppauge instructions, I used a powered TV antenna to locate the channels, and the small antenna supplied with the tuner has worked perfectly ever since. I can record TV, using the tuner-laptop combination as a DVR, or watch over-the air live TV.

Reviews.Title: Worked great
Reviews.Author: Donald J. Price
Reviews.Content: Purchased this to watch Armed Forces Network television on a deployment.  Installed right out of the box without any difficulties.  Software upgrade went without issue and was able to tune all the AFN channels offered.  Remote performs well with my laptop.

Reviews.Title: Bye Cable
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: This product is great. Over the air channels through my computer. Very easy to set up! Great product. Dumping cable and DVR is made so much easier. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: M. E. Band
Reviews.Content: This does exactly what I want.  The Hauppage software is fine but this also works with Windows Media Center, which I prefer.

Reviews.Title: No MP4 video file save capability
Reviews.Author: Snotown
Reviews.Content: Don't understand how Hauppauge can sell a device with software that cannot save video files in the newer MP4 format.  Tablets running Android only play MP4 video files...not the older MPG format that Hauppauge's software files are saved in.  Conversion programs are an unnecessary added cost and the conversion results are inconsistent.  If I am missing something, someone please let me know.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work for me
Reviews.Author: Perkies "H.C."
Reviews.Content: This device just did not work for me. I had to return it. I think that I live too far out in the country. May work better in the city.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Mohammad Alzu'bi
Reviews.Content: Very useful for video recording. You can connect it with VCR convert old video cassettes into digital video with high quality recording.

Reviews.Title: Software was bad
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I bough this to watch tv on my PC. I had bought this one and another cheaper one.  Surprisingly the cheaper no name brand did a better job.  This one worked for a few minutes and then never worked again.  The software was horrible so I used media center on my computer which is fine but this tv tuner did not work.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Merrigan "inquisitive one"
Reviews.Content: The WinTV7 USB tuner works perfectly and my TV now picks up a ton of extra digital channels while using an analog connection. Big money saver over the long term with regard to cable fees.

Reviews.Title: No Cable bill
Reviews.Author: THEONE&ONLY
Reviews.Content: I does what it supposta do & I'm not pay extra to watch tv. Great investment, for what it cost me I've saved so much. I don't watch TV that often and so I didn't want to have to pay for something I don't use that often. Be Well

Reviews.Title: no tv after 1 mo.
Reviews.Author: SilentMira
Reviews.Content: This worked fine for about a month and died.  It think it could have been the heat, but with the tons of effort to set it up, I didn't want to buy another piece of junk to replace it. Looking for a better one. I can only think the positive reviews were done during the 1 month honeymoon period.

Reviews.Title: no tv after 1 mo.
Reviews.Author: SilentMira
Reviews.Content: This worked fine for about a month and died.  It think it could have been the heat, but with the tons of effort to set it up, I didn't want to buy another piece of junk to replace it. Looking for a better one. I can only think the positive reviews were done during the 1 month honeymoon period.

Reviews.Title: Be clear on the limitations
Reviews.Author: Journeyman
Reviews.Content: This device is easy to install, and it pulls in, via cable, all my "local-broadcast" stations, plus a few others, such as WGN, QVC, and the Weather station. If that's what you want if for, it's a great tool.  It does not, however, access all (or even most) of the cable stations I access on my several TV's I use without a cable box.  NOTE: This is direct contradiction to the Claim in Amazon's description "Clear QAM digital TV channels are digital cable channels which can be watched on a TV set without a cable TV set top box."  Thus, I could not get it to access channels such as the History Channel, AMC, etc., and these are the channels in which I was interested.  So, depending on your interests, it's either a * or a ****.Anyone have a different experience?

Reviews.Title: Does not get analog TV
Reviews.Author: William J Brugger
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an older analog only TV adapter.  It got a the few non encrypted digital channels but not any analog channels that the old one revived over cable. .

Reviews.Title: it does not work well
Reviews.Author: chuong pham
Reviews.Content: the signal so weak, and the conversion some how is very slow, the movie run and stop , run stop, run stop. does not run smoothly.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: James "Jim"
Reviews.Content: I use this to record TV shows from my DVR. Then I use AVS4You to transfer them to whatever format I need. I love it!!!

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Douglas S Clark
Reviews.Content: hooked it up to my laptop and an external antenna and I'm amazed at all the channels it picked up and the HD quality of the signal.

Reviews.Title: HDTV for your PC
Reviews.Author: Puao
Reviews.Content: It works as expected, it brings HDTV to your PC and also helps turning your PC to a cheap DVR for the new millenium.

Reviews.Title: Works great with Win 8 64 Pro Media Center on Sony 1080p Laptop & Mohu Antenna
Reviews.Author: TimCO
Reviews.Content: I would've given this tuner 5 stars if I could figure out how to make the remote control work with media center and/or if the antenna was higher quality. I bought this unit because it was listed as compatible by the most people on the Microsoft Win 8 Compatibility Center web site. I haven't been able to get the remote control to work with Media Center. I suspect it only works with the OEM software? I would appreciate any feedback on this if you know otherwise. The included antenna was very poor quality. It gets great reception using a Mohu antenna..

Reviews.Title: Works great, but slight lag on channel changes
Reviews.Author: CC58
Reviews.Content: I have a SiliconDust HomerunHD, but it was not sensitive enough to pickup weak stations even with DB4e antenna and CM777 preamp. Bought the 950Q and it is sensitive and picks up all the weak stations.  Didn't even have to use the driven disk. Win7 automatically got the drivers for WMC, but I'm not using the remote.The only drawback to the 950Q is channel lag.  When you first select a channel for 950Q it takes 4 seconds for it to turn on.  After that, channel changes take about 2 seconds.  The HomerunHD changes channels in a fraction of a second.I decided to only enable weak stations on the 950Q, and the other 90% of channels are enabled on the HomerunHD.  WMC did this easily and now I have a 3 channel DVR.If you are only going to get one receiver, the 950Q is the one to get.  Don't know how well two 950Q would work on one laptop. That would be interesting.

Reviews.Title: This was a Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Jaclyn Rosencutter
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this product!!!!  However, I wish it would function on my Mac Book as well as the PC.  Hauppauge needs to make one for the Mac. I would recommend this item to anyone looking for an item of this nature

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: R. Philipsek
Reviews.Content: This is running on a laptop with Windows seven - no problems. It plays well but I don't think it will record - not enough speed on the laptop processor.

Reviews.Title: Works great, and gives a great picture.
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: Purchased this after my faithful ADS Tech finally gave up.Like this very much as a TV Tuner; and use it on both my desktop computer at home, and on my laptop computer when away from home.Very good set of supplied cables are included; also included is the programing CD, and a small antenna (Read the review on the supplied Antenna below). Also supplied is a trail version of a streaming TV program; "filmontv" that works on Mac or Windows. Windows XP, Windows 7, and Windows Vista are supported by this device. Did not test it on Mac, my installation is Windows 7 64bit.Installation: Very straightforward with this device; follow the instructions supplied; however, before using for the first time I recommend you do a restart on your computer. Install the WinTV-HVR-950Q first, then load the supplied software second, and then do a computer restart before using.Ease of tuning: Great; it has a supplied remote control, and you can pre-load channels to have the ones you watch most often readily available. I don't bother using the remote; once your local channels are scanned, click on them onscreen to bring them up.Picture quality: Depends on local channels signal strength; but outstanding on strong ones.Antenna note: None of the small antennas supplied with these TV Tuners are really good, unless you are close to the local stations; it is an antenna size thing; larger size equals better signal capture area. You can find reasonably small "Amplified Antennas" at your local electronics stores or on the web;  Amazon.com also sells them. You can also hook to an outside antenna at home as I do; which gave me one really interesting signal that should not have been there, note is below under "reception".Channels available: I found 50 in my local area; almost all major local channels also broadcast over the air, and almost all the majors broadcast on more than one channel, including PBS channels. In addition, in some local areas, there are small local broadcasters that can be found with this device by scanning it (educational channels, and other micro-broadcasters); leading to the fun sport of "Find the micro-broadcasters".Reception:Old fashioned NTSC channels (Yes some are still out there, and some are used for other than commercial TV broadcasting).ATSC broadcasts (Digital TV, your present 1080 broadcasting system)QAM (Cable) On scanning I found some interesting over the air non-cable channels, and some duplicates of ATSC signals.Have fun if you like to find new signals; one was a satellite signal.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Timetoride
Reviews.Content: I agree with others who say it works really well for them.  I've used it with both cable and the antenna.  I get all the channels in clearly on both and only once had an issue.  That issue is the reason it gave this 4 rather than 5 stars.  I've had this unit for well over a year and had an issue with my PC and had to reload the software.  I could not find the disk anywhere and went to their site assuming I could download the software.  Nada.  They said I had to pay $9 for a replacement!  I did contact them and the sent me an older disk, which I did really appreciate, but it was a long wait.  I just wish they had the software on their site and don't understand why they wouldn't do that.  It makes for better customer service to have it out there.  That's my only gripe.  I really love the unit and it works great for me on my Windows 7 Pro 64 bit system.  I'd buy one again!

Reviews.Title: 5 Star Quality and Service
Reviews.Author: danny
Reviews.Content: 5 Star Quality and Service. This is my second unit that I have purchased so, this one was very easy to install, It Arrived quickly.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Nice, But...
Reviews.Author: John J. Agnew, Jr. "CD Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: My sister purchased this or similar, but w/o remote. It was impressive with the amount of channels it received with a decent antenna. I purchased this to use with a laptop. All seemed fine; even with the little (supplied) whip antenna, it managed to received about (16) channels. I tried the remote; it seemed to work. However, the next day, all the remote was capable of doing is changing channels, via the up/down channel toggle switch, nothing else worked. No documentation is provided or on the manufacturer's web site for the remote.Anyone else able to get the remote working fully?

Reviews.Title: eh
Reviews.Author: Mr.geektoyou
Reviews.Content: Does tune in channels. Works with Windows Media Center. The that comes with the device is clunky and the remote is worse.Plug it in and use the Media Center App on windows to tune in your channels and you will have a better experience. Pitch the remote. It is the next best thing to useless. Not even big enough for a coaster.

Reviews.Title: Filling the final gap with a WD TV Live
Reviews.Author: J-Man
Reviews.Content: As much as I love my excellent WD TV Live box, in my pursuit of completely cutting ties with cable TV, there were still occasions when I would've liked to have had access to live television. Enter this nifty little gadget.Since this is one of the recommended HDTV over-the-air (OTA) tuners specifically recommended by Western Digital, I assumed there would be no compatibility issues. And there weren't. The only downsides are that reception can occasionally be spotty (rare but intermittent picture freezes for just a second or so) and that it takes a noticeably long time to switch between stations. Also, when you first hook this up, be prepared to wait a while for it to scan across the spectrum for available stations.I'm fortunate to live in a relatively large metropolitan area, so I immediately had access (on the first channel sweep) to every major broadcast station's OTA signal in glorious HD -- with quality on par with a wired cable connection. Goodbye forever, cable TV!

Reviews.Title: good adapter
Reviews.Author: Constantin Serban
Reviews.Content: Works very well, no issues with it whatsoever. I own it for almost one yearand use it almost daily. I do not use its software, remote, or antenna.I have small aluminum loop on top of my house, receive ~30 channels from the NY-NJ area(Edison, NJ.) I use it with Windows Media Center and I have a Windows 7 touchscreen allinone,with a remote. Programmed recording works fine in WMC. Between this device and Internet programming,who needs cable? Easily one of the wisest purchases I've made over the last few years.Gave 4 rating b/c sometimes I wished that I bought the model that supports two simultaneous channels,(to record something while I watch something else.) This is not a shortcoming of this model in any way, Idid not foresee my usage pattern well enough.

Reviews.Title: Great device!
Reviews.Author: Dexter Francis
Reviews.Content: The software installed without any problems and everything is working. It is even working great on one of my slower computers. A very good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre Satisfaction
Reviews.Author: Ignacio
Reviews.Content: Although the product works as described, it is not consistent and I have had to reinstall it several times. Perhaps a free software update would be in order.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Darren
Reviews.Content: This has been a great tuner for the most part no real problems with it. I'm using it on a  Mac Mini with EyeTV without any major problemsthe only reason I've given it 4 stars is due to heat from the tuner and the remote don't work with apple products, no driver.I have downloaded a mouse program to my phone that works fairly well though and is satisfactory for my needs.

Reviews.Title: fantastic
Reviews.Author: johnny arizona
Reviews.Content: i've messed around with other brands when it comes to pc tv but i always seem to go back to hauppauge, a brand you can trust.

Reviews.Title: Works good
Reviews.Author: unhappy customer
Reviews.Content: We like this item.  The frustrating thing is that you have to completely record your program before you can begin watching it.  There may be a newer Hauppauge item out there that allows a second viewing screen.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV tuner!!
Reviews.Author: Lexie123
Reviews.Content: I barely make reviews, but I'm taking time to make one for this product.  I purchased this yesterday at Best Buy (I should've checked the price of Amazon first because I paid $20 more at Best Buy), but I was already enjoying all the channels that this thing picked up.  I initially used the Windows Media Center that came with my old Windows 7 PC, but WMC only picked up the analog channels.  When I used the WinTV software that came with the product, however, all digital and analog channels were picked up, including some local HD channels (ABC, Fox, CBS, etc...).  The only drawback is that it doesn't have a program guide like WMC and I have to rename every single channel.  When I schedule a recording, I have to look up the shows on my favorite channels and manually put in the time and duration of the recording.  Other than that, I was surprised at how many channels this little thing picked up.  I'm very happy with it, so far and all I need to do now is purchase a 2TB external hard drive that I'll connect to the computer PC since my old PC only has 350 GB of hard drive (well, less than that, of course because of all the other programs I have in it).  It wasn't hard to install at all.  The channel scanning does take a while to finish, but it's worth the wait.  I will just have to take the channel lineup from my cable provider and check each channel and rename them.  I don't watch all channels anyway, so it's all good.

Reviews.Title: A great product.
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Overall, It works much better than I expected.  The accompaning software is equally impressively.  This was a good value purchase.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge TV tuner
Reviews.Author: Richard Lacaille
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect this product to be so difficult to install. I have a new computer with windows 7. Couldn't get it to installproperly. Installed windows 8 pro, still can't get it to install correctly. I've written to Hauppauge support. Playingemail tag, one question at a time. I'm pretty knowledgable on my computer, so I've followed the directions to noprevail. Can I return this product?. Frustrated customer, Richard LaCaille

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: William H. Nesheim "village fool and idiot"
Reviews.Content: I do not use the enclosed antenna or remote so this is only about the HVR. Very easy to set up. Right click on the screen to get into the record menu, set the time and channel to record and forget it. My laptop has a HDMI out so viewing is also super easy and very clear in HD.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge
Reviews.Author: Tyler M
Reviews.Content: Pros:Packaging was perfect and easy to open.Item worked as expected and shipped fast.Picture quality is fair, much better when using composite or svideo or digital cable vs analog.Perfect if you're looking for something cheap that works.Cons:Remote does not work with MacSoftware does not work with MacGets HOT during use

Reviews.Title: Good little device
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I use this on my notebook to catch TV in my office some times.  It is a little slow to change channels, and setup is a bit cumbersome, but once it is on it works great.  The over the air high def channels look great.

Reviews.Title: remote
Reviews.Author: mr g
Reviews.Content: product works great except few channel dosen,t work remote control do not work at all.easy to install 3 stars ok.

Reviews.Title: Just would not work ...
Reviews.Author: Fred "Fred"
Reviews.Content: tried this on several computers.....would work SOMETIMES on 2 windows 7 machines, And sometimes would work on a Windows XP , but on one Windows 7 machine it would not work at all.......tried searching for newer drivers, software, etc.....and all  I could find was what was shipped with the item......no problem with Amazon doing a return......still looking for something that will work with off air and cable ........

Reviews.Title: Mostly works
Reviews.Author: Jose Diaz
Reviews.Content: I installed the unit on my media server and setup was easy. Needs a stronger antenna as my off the air channels are not all coming in strong.

Reviews.Title: Good but not great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "1sympleman"
Reviews.Content: The software wouldn't install on my windows 8 computer. It installed properly on my Vista computer, but the program would often quit running while in use. I have given up on the included sotware and have been running the tuner in the windows media center with good results.

Reviews.Title: Great TV tuner
Reviews.Author: Bryant Kettle "Bryant"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV tuner.  Very easy to install and use.  Plug and Play.  The quality of the video and sound is great as well.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Just what I expected, works great-lots of options for various things.You will like this product.I need to test video with laptop at various sites and this make it easy not to pack a tv.

Reviews.Title: Nothing But Problems
Reviews.Author: Average Joe
Reviews.Content: Zonk! I had nothing but problems with this unit and ended up returning it after having wasted many hours of my time trying to get it to work.  The software froze frequently.  The machine I was installing on was running windows 7 and well above the stated system requirements.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Rich P
Reviews.Content: I've used Hauppauge PCI TV tuner cards for years but this was my first time trying out a USB tuner.First I have to say that instructions are still weak for Hauppauge products.  This was a clean install so there were no conflicts with old versions.  But if you are upgrading from a previous Hauppauge product or software be sure to uninstall all drivers, etc.  Hauppauge has a utility on their web site to assist with this  [...]They have made the new install more friendly.  To avoid problems I do recommend restarting the computer after the drivers are installed, but before the program gets installed.Overall product review.  Channel changes are a little slow, especially going from analog to digital or vice versa.  But the picture is incredibly clear.  I tested the included telescoping antenna and had good quality inside a house 10-15 miles from the transmitters for most digital channels.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: Phil Konstantin "phil_konstantin"
Reviews.Content: The local stations it finds are pretty good. However, in San Diego, it did not find a couple of the network stations.The "thumbdrive" type connector gets hot during use.Otherwise, it is as advertized

Reviews.Title: TV Tuner Stick for PC
Reviews.Author: Damon Philpot
Reviews.Content: The Hauppauge TV Tuner stick that I ordered From the Amazon website was deliverd quickly and undamaged, It is a great product. Better then a DVR with great functions.Hauppauge 1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick/Personal Video Recorder with Clear QAM and Remote Control (Black)

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge 1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner
Reviews.Author: John Lynch
Reviews.Content: I had a Hauppage PVR 150 card that I used to watch and record TV on my computer, but when I upgraded to a new computer, the old card wouldn't fit. I bought the HVR-950Q and love it. I started out using the WINTV 7 interface so I could record programs in MPEG2. This works fine, but recently I've been hooked by the Windows Media Center interface. The video files aren't as universal as the MPEG2 files, but the interface is so easy to use. For less than $70 I got a device that plays on my computer and works like TIVO without the monthly fee.

Reviews.Title: Works pretty good
Reviews.Author: North2AK
Reviews.Content: The tuner works great and is easy to setup.  My only complaint is that the remote doesn't work quite so well.  The range is poor.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!,  Works on MacBook Pro with EyeTV Software
Reviews.Author: Ivan
Reviews.Content: This TV Tuner is awesome and it works on Mac. You just have to use the EyeTV software because the software that comes with it is only for windows. Obviously the remote is not going to work because your not using its software but you can use the apple remote to change channels up and down, control the volume, pause, FF, and Rewind. With the antenna that came with it I get 25 channels in full HD. You can view shows in full screen and it looks awesome.  The next day I bought a better antenna and now I get 44 channels.  So long paying for basic cable. If your thinking of getting the EyeTV Tuner don't. Get this instead its the same thing but cheaper.

Reviews.Title: So far, ok
Reviews.Author: Seth Thomas "beemerron"
Reviews.Content: This products functions well, except that I use it on my laptop and it freezes up whenever the USB connection gets ever so slightly touched. The only way to restore it is to restart the computer.This problem may be a function of the USB port, however, even using the USB connector wire, it is a device protruding from the side of a laptop and is susceptible to jarring.

Reviews.Title: PC TV recorder
Reviews.Author: Jon Strub
Reviews.Content: I received the item very quickly.  Have had no complaints about the product since i started using it.  Once i got it set up it was good to go.  The device you connect does get pretty hot once you are down just to make people aware.  I wish it would record the TV in a little bit bigger caption but overall the device works just like it says in the description.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Works as I basically expected. I wish it was a little easier to change channels but so far no other problems

Reviews.Title: Wintv 950Q
Reviews.Author: Chas
Reviews.Content: Was easy to set and use. The Titan TV guide is very useful for programing recordings. Receives all my Time Warner Cable channels that I pay for. Movies are then edited in windows 7 and saved to a disc. No problems at all. Have no use for the extra items with 950Q, but maybe useful in the future. After purchase, I wondered if I should have bought a tuner card instead. Happy I didn't. Can be used with my laptop also. Satisfied with the product.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Install & Works Fine
Reviews.Author: R. Ordowich
Reviews.Content: Installed it on an older laptop with USB 1.0, and even on this device the results were acceptable although there was some jerkiness of the picture.On a laptop running Windows 7 and USB 2.0 it worked great. The laptop is connected to a 42" LCD display and picture quality is excellent. Installation worked without a hitch and after scanning for QAM open channels on cable, it was up and running. The recording feature works fine and the ability to pause viewling is really handy.Only complaint is that sometimes if I change channels sequentially, WinTV locks up and takes about a minute to recover and occasionally I have to close WinTV and restart it.

Reviews.Title: Quality tuner, but I could only get local channels.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: I bought this with the hopes on turning my home theater pc into a DVR. It was definitely a pro that it can get HD channels, but I could only get my local channels in HD as well as some local channels in standard definition. Unfortunately I could not get it to work with my Comcast box (HD DVR) but I still was able to get about 15 HD channels. It was very simple to set up and the small remote that came with it was somewhat handy. It also came with a small antenna to aid in getting extra channels. All things considered I would recommend this product if you are in the market for an HD TV tuner; It's relatively cheap, small, easy to set up and gets HD.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: It works. Records very well, "excellent quality" with small file size. Will work on Win XP SP2 but not on Win XP SP3, which seems to take much research to discover or a bad experience. The HD antenna isn't all that great, a lot has to do with the area one lives. Some areas have much more to offer in the area of signals and some only have a few to begin with. Can't fault the availability of only a few channels on the antenna. Still, the antenna isn't all that great but will do. Saw no heat problem that was noted in other reviews. If you have Win XP SP2 and cable you should be pleased with this. Oh, and this being a usb stick gives a freedom/mobility to use this on different systems, arr arr arr (lol).

Reviews.Title: Not bad for what it does
Reviews.Author: US male shopper
