Reviews.Content: I purchase this Hauppauge 1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner so I would have some sort of entertainment besides watching internet videos all the time. It did exactly what I wanted it for, I now can watch local regular and HD TV on my laptop external HD display and not have to pay some cable company for service. Would recommend this for anybody who just wants something that will pull in some local stations and not have rent movies or sign-up for cable service while out in the field.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for what it does
Reviews.Author: US male shopper
Reviews.Content: I purchase this Hauppauge 1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner so I would have some sort of entertainment besides watching internet videos all the time. It did exactly what I wanted it for, I now can watch local regular and HD TV on my laptop external HD display and not have to pay some cable company for service. Would recommend this for anybody who just wants something that will pull in some local stations and not have rent movies or sign-up for cable service while out in the field.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge 1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner
Reviews.Author: tbh
Reviews.Content: It works well when it works, but has been crashing a lot lately (just goes away).  Hopefully I can get to the bottom of what the problem is with Windows 7 Home Premium and Version 7.2 of the software.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Eric Cheung
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for HTPC to capture OTA TV signals and use the HTPC as DVR. Works great. No problem searching for channels, watching live TV, and recording digital channels. It is very small and compact. I did not use the remote control as I have a MCE remote for the HTPC.

Reviews.Title: PC TV
Reviews.Author: Mundelein Reviewer "Mundelein - L"
Reviews.Content: Works fine.  Better tuning when using an a central antenna versus the supplied "expanding stick" antenna but that should be expected.  Very easy to install and operate.

Reviews.Title: Confusing but worth the trouble
Reviews.Author: Brian Miller "b-rian"
Reviews.Content: It does feel with this Hauppauge tuner that an imperfect product dropped from the sky with few instructions. I wish someone had told me from the beginning to use Windows Media Center so now I would like to tell you, in case you haven't read the other reviews that repeat this. WinTV freezes frequently on my computer but Windows Media Center works perfectly. And keep the antenna close to a window. A better antenna might help your reception but sometimes no antenna can help a bad location. The remote control works with WinTV but not with Windows Media Center. Although I am making the remote obsolete, I really doubt I will open the WinTV software again if I can prevent it. I am giving four stars instead of five because WinTV software is bad, and since it is bad, the remote doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: Good addition to Desk Top
Reviews.Author: Jim L. O'donley
Reviews.Content: Have purchased a Hauppauge product and installed in an older desk top.  Again very satisfied with the Hauppauge 1191 on the newer desktop.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Excellent HD computer antenna
Reviews.Author: Jesse B Bartholomew
Reviews.Content: Kind of wish Hauppauge made a 34mm Express card version if they did I would have gotten that. As it is this version will do nicely. Plus I can use it with the desktop when I get home. Setup was easy, just plugged it in and downloaded the latest drivers, and I was off to the races. The recorder app that comes with it is useless other than the remote support. Use Windows Media Center for most of my viewing. Only complaint I have is with the remote, or more precisely the battery in the remote. Not only was it dead, it didn't even register any bars on the battery checker. Got one of my spares out and it works like a dream. Plus I finally have a use for that useless PC card slot on my Dell Precision.

Reviews.Title: Great product, takes a little time to figure it all out
Reviews.Author: open to it all
Reviews.Content: I love this product because it just works.  Scheduling recordings is easy with Titan tv website.  I like using Win TV better than Windows Media Center.  Win TV is a focused application while WMC just does too much.  I had to work a while to pick up all my channels and antenna placement is key but this is no different than my other HD setups.  Win 7 detected everything.  No issues whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: Works great -- may be not
Reviews.Author: Real_Name
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these from [...] and am using them with a windows7 pc. I had an external dual tuner earlier, but it required a couple of extra wires which i didn't like. The usb sticks work great (though i had to use the usb extender cable as they are too big to occupy adjacent usb slots)Installation: Didn't do anything. Windows identified the tuners and did whatever was needed. I am using the media center with basic cable, and it scanned for all the available channels without much input from me. It has been more than 2 weeks now and the system has been working great mostly. There is an occasional stuttering in video but I suspect it's because of the CPU/graphics limitation and not because of the tuner.Accessories: They provide a lot of accessories which I wish weren't there. Among them, an antenna and a pretty inconvenient remote. I hope they come up with a package which doesn't include this and we can help reduce some waste (and that's the reason I am taking off one star). The remote didn't work but I suspect I have to install the WinTV software for that. I wasn't going to use WinTV or the remote anyway, so gave up on the remote after few seconds.I also purchased a windows MC remote from amazon (http://www.amazon.com/Windows-Control-Infrared-Receiver-Ultimate/dp/B00224ZDFY/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1293048243&sr;=8-1) and it works great with rest of the system.EDITED in DEC, 2011:After having used this tuner for a long time, there are a couple of significant changes in my opinion. First, the default Windows 7 driver started causing problems only after a few days but it was all ok once I installed the driver that came with the tuner (nothing wrong with that)Secondly, for past few months, the tuner(s) has(have) been acting up. Frequently(once every 2-3 days), one or both the tuners will stop working and Win MC will say that I should restart my computer to resolve the problem. A reboot usually works but it's a major inconvenience. And if I don't see this error message, it will not record programs till I reboot. Also, changing channels while watching live TV is extremely slowBottom line: Not recommended

Reviews.Title: Easy installation and good quality picture
Reviews.Author: Krishna Samavedam
Reviews.Content: This is my second HD PVR. The first one is ATI TV Wonder series.. The device is good but had crappy supporting software. This came with a all good accessories and decent software. I have installed it on Win 7. I use the software that came with this instead of media center. This works perfectly for my basic needs.Pros: - Good picture quality - PVR software has rich set of features -Cons: - Software hung one in last two weeks - Getting around software to customize is not that easy.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup and use
Reviews.Author: Paul Hillebrand
Reviews.Content: This was easy to install and use on my HP computer with Windows 7.  The Media Center works well and has excellent picture quality.  The small antenna is easy to hide.  I don't use much of the advanced features but for basic watching of local broadcast TV it is fantastic.  Considering that it turns nearly any laptop into a TV is great.  I recommend it highly!Paul in Cincinnati

Reviews.Title: Problems with Hauppauge WinTV Software
Reviews.Author: R. Bailey
Reviews.Content: I had no problem installing the WinTV software on a Dell with Microsoft Windows XP.The main problem I had, is every time I try to launch the WinTV software half of the time I would get a NO SIGNAL Error.Then I would have to exit the program and re-launch it again and hope it will start, before I could view a TV channel.In setting up the schedule to record, you can set the date, time, and channel, but when the software starts to lanch the program to recond, I would get the NO SIGNAL Error again and miss recording the show.If it had better more reliable software, this could be a great product

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge tuner works as advertised
Reviews.Author: mavikuke
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Hauppauge tuner for my Sony Laptop and Dell desktop.  I am using it with cable on the desktop.  I used Windows Media Center for the installation and have had no problems, installation was a breeze.  I could not get a very good signal with the included antenna so I can't say how good it will work outside.

Reviews.Title: Works great with Windows Media Center
Reviews.Author: karl
Reviews.Content: This tuner produces very good quality video from almsot any source and works great with Windows Media Ceneter.

Reviews.Title: I got the product I expected
Reviews.Author: Jose Zerpa
Reviews.Content: I fully recommend this product. It's easy to install, easy to use and gives the functionality I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: vandergraaf
Reviews.Content: Installation was very easy on Windows 7 Ultimate. I installed only the Windows Media Center interface (provided on the product's web page) and I used WMC for setup/channel finding. All drivers installed correctly. I plugged the antenna in and I was able to watch over-the-air HDTV plus several other channels. It also works well with cable signal (we just have basic cable - no HD signal). I also took the small antenna outdoor and connected it to a longer cable with a basic UHF amplifier and I was able to add few other channels. I'll most likely get rid of basic cable as the indoor antenna provides clear HD signals from local stations. This thing is good for what it is supposed to do. I have not tried the remote as I am using a WMC remote.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge 1191
Reviews.Author: Henri "down to earth"
Reviews.Content: It works as advertised. I used it to transfer all my mini DV tapes to CDs. TV reception works but depends on the location. Good product.

Reviews.Title: Small & Compact Powerhouse
Reviews.Author: MightyOak
Reviews.Content: Unit performs better than expected after a simple install. Picture quality is excellent and portability a big plus.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick
Reviews.Author: Michael Cone
Reviews.Content: Works fantastic, I can move it between computers to watch or record, the included software is nice but it integrates nicely with Windows Media Center in Windows Vista or Windows 7 which I personally prefer.

Reviews.Title: Haupage
Reviews.Author: Luther A. Miracle "Really Old Geek"
Reviews.Content: I followed the included install instructions perfectly and then spent about 2 hours fixing my computer.  Even though I've been using computers since the Great Flood and should have known better, I plugged the device into the USB port as instructed, before installing the software from the CD.  If you make it past that, it works great.

Reviews.Title: WinTV
Reviews.Author: David A. Carr "David A Carr"
Reviews.Content: Product works as advertised, quality is good, no problems with product or seller. Amazon has been my seller for many items and has never disappointed. Always quality products. Only upgrade I would do is a better ant. This one is just not enough to get a good sig.

Reviews.Title: Cool Product
Reviews.Author: T. Devor
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a way to watch football and basketball while being stuck in a different venue every weekend. I considered satallite tv before I happened upon this product on Amazon. This is a bargan at 70 bucks.  It doesn't work everywhere, but I've been able to get decent reception more times than not.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: R. E. Ringdahl
Reviews.Content: I used this tuner with my Windows computer.  I had first installed it on my computer when I was using Vista and now with 7.  It's very easy to use.  I don't like the software it comes with, but it works well with the Media Center.  I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: computer-based HD TV
Reviews.Author: Sam Electro "classico"
Reviews.Content: I was not able to successfully use this product because my computer may have a graphics card that is not powerful enough to run the Hauppauge digital HD TV program. I was never able to successfully load and play the tuner program.  It is my understanding that this piece of electronics does best on a dual core computer (and the appropriate graphics card).

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick/Personal Video Recorder with Clear QAM and Remote Control (Black)
Reviews.Author: virgildeand
Reviews.Content: Have a clear and good reception of signals. Software hangs up sometimes in Windows 7 64 bits.But it is ok.

Reviews.Title: Works well, but could be better
Reviews.Author: David A. Stone "DAS"
Reviews.Content: It does work but the tuner gets very hot after a while, additionally it would be great if they had a better interface for channel menue and for recording thru the menu.

Reviews.Title: Great stick for ubuntu
Reviews.Author: Sergio "Sergio"
Reviews.Content: I have installed this tuner on a Dell Inspiron E1505 running Ubuntu 9.04. It works pretty good up to a certain extent. If you are running Ubuntu 9.04 you need to download the firmware, tvtime and kaffeine. The firmware is necessary for any application to use the stick. In order to watch over the air digital TV (ATSC) the only two things that I needed were the firmware and Kaffeine. However, Kaffeine will not play analog TV.  Tvtime is a good software to do the job. ( Although, I needed a workaround to get sound). However, after I updated to the last kernel I lost all analog capabilities (still trying to get analog tv back).Overall, it is a great and well supported digital TV tuner for Ubuntu. However, the analog tuner side of it is not as well supported and you are going to spend some time making it work if you plan to install it on Ubuntu.

Reviews.Title: Not a simple process
Reviews.Author: Rants/Raves "Hyper Critic"
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a no-brainer.  Easier if Media Center software used, but still have problems with burnt DVD's skipping and freezing when played back on DVD/TV.  Perhaps my DVD player?  DVD's seem to play back on computer but early times yet.Certainly not Tivo competition yet.  Both the tuner and Media Center need lots more work.

Reviews.Title: Works OK but too difficult to load
Reviews.Author: Thurlow114 "Thurlow114@comcast.net"
Reviews.Content: The proudct was too difficult to load and too slow. Heats up quite a bit during operation as well. WOrk OK oncce loaded and set up.

Reviews.Title: No Clear Qam on Windows Media Center - WinTV Software is typical Hauppage
Reviews.Author: Morimoto "Morimoto"
Reviews.Content: Its a fine analog tuner and HD Clear-QAM works with WinTV, but Clear-QAM does not work with Windows Media Center (although I have heard rumors it will in the Windows 7 version). To be fair, that is a problem with WMC and not the tuner.However, the included WinTV software is typical Hauppage crap that just barely does what you need it to. It amazes me that after all these years, they haven't bothered to spend $1 on a decent stock icon - the icon for this program has been the same for years, and looks like a gradeschooler made it for Windows 3.0.With 4GB of RAM and 2.4GHz Quad-core processor, the picture is fine and there is minimal stuttering with HD, channel changes take 3s but can take longer.Along with the icon, Hauppage has keep the same old configuration dialog boxes for WinTV, which are abysmal and sometimes unclearly labeled.Recently, when I have tried to edit the channel suite the dialog never comes up and the tv controls are unusable. Frustrating.Screenshots in HD come out skewed and unusable.Hauppage really needs to outsource WinTV to a different software company and rewrite it from the ground up.I did like that they included a short USB extension cable as the unit is to o big to allow other USB devices to plugin to any slots adjacent to it.

Reviews.Title: It works OK
Reviews.Author: W. J. Chatham "C3"
Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a replacement for a flimsy PCI Express TV card.  I don't use the included software.  It works fine with my Media Center.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: T. Takahashi
Reviews.Content: I only use it with Windows Media Center, it works great though!  Does everything it should.  Very nice feature to have on the computer.

Reviews.Title: Software needs work
Reviews.Author: A. Takemiya
Reviews.Content: I bought this item because I wanted to be able to record HD programs. That function worked perfectly however there were some other things that bugged me enough that I ended up returning the item. I have an older Hauppauge PVR250 that is much more responsive than the 950Q. The 950Q channel changing is really slow which I found to be too irritating to use. The picture quality was excellent though and the 950Q found all the QAM signals on my Cox cable (San Pedro, CA). Unfortunately I could not get the QAM stations to show up using Vista Media Center. I tried some of the Vista patches available to fix that but was not successful and did not want to completely re-install Vista (recommended for the patch installation).In the end I purchased Tivo to do my HD recording and so far am loving it.

Reviews.Title: Save your money
Reviews.Author: customer
Reviews.Content: The software is a pain to use, the remote never worked.  The quality is FAR from HD.  Windows Media Center comes free with your computer, so you may as well buy a cheaper tuner and use it with Media Center, which can schedule recordings much easier than this software, and has a better user interface, so forget all the fancy stuff this piece of junk comes with.  It is also too wide to plug into the computer if you want another USB device next to it, so you need to buy a USB extension chord.  Does not work when plugged into a USB extender hub, but it makes lovely noises when you do.

Reviews.Title: Holy Freakin' Awful Installation
Reviews.Author: David "Psychiatrist"
Reviews.Content: It is hard to imagine a worse installation and initiation process:1. Drivers did not recognize stick2. Had to run install from Windows 7 using XP mode3. Did not work with antenna that was included.4. Bought another antenna, which didn't work because it wasn't powered.5. Bought another antenna designed for HDTV, didn't know the problem was weak signal6. Bought an amplified antenna7. Software had to be updated.8. Internet explorer crashed downloading the updated software.9. Updated software took a couple of hours to figure-out the install10. Updated install went in the opposite order the website tells you to do it.11. Hard to re-run install from the installation CD that was actually provided, because of a wording problem in the instructions.12. Still didn't work13. Finally got video capture to work off of VCR14. Took 2 hours, incredibly counter-intuitive interface15. Microsoft .net version 2 not installed16. Repeating process17. .net framework finally downloaded as recommended/required by WinTV 718. .net framework not compatible with 64 bit windows, (JESUS!!! This is the updated software!!!)19. Computer restart20. Repeated loop of this stupid thing not working, the .net framework is required, and now will not install the updated version.21. After manually installing latest driver, and activating and reconfiguring Windows Media Center (necessitating the change of privileges for the wmpnetwk.exe program that was using 99% of CPU), and now it can received signal... just one channel, 6.1, showing a weight-loss infomercial.22. Win7TV update was never able to be installed on Windows 7You know, when you name a program WinTV7, people might think it works with something like... Windows 7.  Updates should be provided.This was an atrocious install, for a very minimally valuable product.8 restarts of one computer required during installIt did not work much better on an XP machineAwful, just unbelievably awful.

Reviews.Title: TV Anywhere -- Almost Always!
Reviews.Author: tempgal
Reviews.Content: I originally bought the Hauppauge WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner as an accessory for a new laptop computer that didn't offer an integrated tv tuner at the time that I ordered it.  The unit configured perfectly and easily and I received prompt assistance from a Hauppauge representative for the one question that I had.  A short USB extension cable is provided which protects your laptop from the heat generated by almost any TV tuner and I strongly recommend its use.Ultimately, the tuner turned out not to be as useful for the laptop as anticipated because of a lack of OTA channels in our area and the fact that if I am near a cable coaxial connection, I have no need to watch TV on a laptop.Determined to get my money's worth from my investment, I connected the USB Hauppauge to a desktop computer that was in a room with a cable connection and signed up for a free account at Orb.com.  That was a good move.  Now I have access to a TV anyplace where there is a computer with online access (providing, of course, that my home computer is on and connected to the internet) and the video and audio quality is excellent.Because of the USB connection, this type of unit offers tremendous portability advantages over integrated TV tuners.  You can always remove it from a desktop and pack it in your laptop case if you are likely to be in an area where there are OTA channels.  If you buy a new computer, you need not buy another TV tuner as long as this works.  And, having it plugged in a few inches away from the USB slot is also much healthier for your computer.I'm thoroughly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Won't install.  No useful customer service.
Reviews.Author: David Hack
Reviews.Content: Tried to install on two machines, one Windows 7 and one Windows 8.  Used supplied CD and also downloaded latest S/W and drivers.  Had similar failures on all four combinations of S/W and machine.  The only customer service is during weekday business hours.  Held for 11 minutes and then was told to leave a call back message.  I can't take off work to deal with it.  Forums I found mostly said, "Good luck with this."  Wish I'd read them first.  Returned the product.

Reviews.Title: So-so
Reviews.Author: Eric Law
Reviews.Content: This unit is fairly easy to set up and use, and definitely does what the manufacturer claims it will do.But... it gets noticeably poorer reception than our TV (a Panasonic plasma about a year old) in spite of being connected to the same antenna.  And it runs *really* hot - enough that I'm concerned about its long-term reliability.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: dwrand
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this!! I bought this in April 2012 and have nothing but hassles with it since (now 10/12). It has constantly frozen up, cannot tune over the air stations and has had to be reinstalled multiple times. I just purchased a new Dell with 8 GB RAM 3210 CPU and it still does not work. It finally totally died tonight and cannot find any cable stations or tune in antenna stations. I am tired of reinstalling it. Do not buy this piece of junk!!

Reviews.Title: True Plug and Play and AMERICAN support !
Reviews.Author: D-Bronx
Reviews.Content: I've turned my Win7 PC into a PVR!!Recording high def is a cinch as the included app scans for unencrpyted HD content. This product works flawlessly for me. I have not tried the included antenna that turns your laptop into a TV or the included remote.Included WinTV app works like a lite Windows Media Center, enabling you to schedule recordings. What was most delightful to me was the fact that support is actually located in Hauppuge, New York! I got two day responses to my simple question from someone on this side of the pond. Kudos to Hauppauge for keeping American techs working.Product works flawlessly, works fine with my Windows Media Center (64-bit Win7) and support is in America. BUY WITH CONFIDENCE and PRIDE.

Reviews.Title: True Plug and Play and AMERICAN support !
Reviews.Author: D-Bronx
Reviews.Content: I've turned my Win7 PC into a PVR!!Recording high def is a cinch as the included app scans for unencrpyted HD content. This product works flawlessly for me. I have not tried the included antenna that turns your laptop into a TV or the included remote.Included WinTV app works like a lite Windows Media Center, enabling you to schedule recordings. What was most delightful to me was the fact that support is actually located in Hauppuge, New York! I got two day responses to my simple question from someone on this side of the pond. Kudos to Hauppauge for keeping American techs working.Product works flawlessly, works fine with my Windows Media Center (64-bit Win7) and support is in America. BUY WITH CONFIDENCE and PRIDE.

Reviews.Title: save your dough and look else where
Reviews.Author: Arun Agrawal
Reviews.Content: If your are people like here who can get practically anything to work then go ahead and buy this else just drop the idea, to put it plain it does not work out of the box. The included usb cable is small and provided antenna is joke at best. I spent almost a day figuring out a way to make it work. Tried on windows vista & windows 7 media center...no luck. Tried it with bundled s/w, still no luck. This product should be removed from amazon.

Reviews.Title: returning this item after 3 days of use
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: purchased this item because i canx my cable all together.  and since i was going to have a laptop hooked up to my TV, i figured this was going to be a great option to watch a few channels now and then.  the CD that came with the unit is outdated as far as drivers are concern.  i end up getting the update info from the website.  after a few installed/uninstalled i finally got to go through the set up to look for channels in my area.  since i don't live in the city, i figured i would get about 6 channels like abc, pbs and fox. the software found 10 channels so i was very happy to see that.  once the set up was complete, i wanted to see what this WinTV had to offer.  first, i would freeze on me, and i had to re-boot my laptop.  after a few reboots, i got it to bring up CW.  the picture quality was awful.  half the time i could only see the top half of the picture frame.  when i would try to change channels, it would freeze my laptop.  i still don't know what was cousin all of these problems.  my laptop is brand new win7 asus.  i'm returning this item and will not be getting anything else at this time.  i might be living in the area that's not great for getting free HD channels over the air.

Reviews.Title: I absolutely could not get this working with Windows 7
Reviews.Author: capt1914
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for a Lenovo T500 Thinkpad running Windows 7 ultimate (64bit). I had no luck getting the tv tuner drivers to install correctly. Windows would report successful installation but all I would see is a black screen on the tv viewer application. I finally gave up after several hours of trying. On the same exact laptop, I also dual boot Ubuntu Linux 10.04. I had some success with Linux. I had to use two different programs to get everything working. I used Kaffeine to get ATSC signals, and then the program "TVtime" was the only one I found that worked for analog cable (after minor configuration changes).Just because I was frustrated that I could not get this item working with Windows 7, I tried it on a different laptop I own that also has Windows 7 installed (a Lenovo Thinkpad X100e with Windows 7 Home premium 32bit). With this laptop, again I had no luck getting the software to install correctly. I received different errors with this laptop than the first, but the bottom line is it did not work with Windows 7.Finally just for laughs, I tried installing the TV tuner on a 6yr old IBM Thinkpad T42 running Windows XP professional. The tuner software installed no problem on this system, but the old laptop's hardware seemed too slow to view video without frames dropping.All in all, I am disappointed with this product. Hauppauge needs to work on its drivers for Win7.

Reviews.Title: Cable tv on your PC
Reviews.Author: Handy Man
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to connect my cable to my computer. I have FIOS and was only interested in the ClearQAM channels. Installed by connecting it to the RF cable using a splitter. It took a while to find all the channels( it found a total of 512, not all ClearQAM). I ended up with about 30 ClearQAM channels when done.If your not sure what ClearQAM is, it's the unscrambled channels.Why only 4 stars? The software that comes with it is very poor. Picture is fine, starting & stopping fine, recording is great, but renaming channels and removing or adding is terrible. The person who wrote this software should be digging ditches not writing software.Only 4 stars because of the software, hardware is very good.

Reviews.Title: Too basic
Reviews.Author: MC96
Reviews.Content: This tuner was disappointing. The software is too simple, not very many options, not too friendly. Set up is easy but the tuner program is just too tedious to work with.Got it, installed it, tried it out, got disappointed, returned it.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge TV Tuner, Use Windows Media Center NOT the WinTV software provided
Reviews.Author: Donald Grasser "dgrasser"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV tuner so that I could watch TV on my laptop when I am away from home.I plugged in the tuner into the USB port and Windows XP automatically found the correct drivers.  Then I installed the provided WinTV software and it continually froze up my computer.  I tried Windows Media Center and that worked great, including the signal strength indicators in the channel setup.I am about 40 miles from the nearest television stations and could not get any stations with the provided antenna.I tried a rabbit ears antenna and got one station if I held the antenna in a precise and steady position.  If I move it just slightly, I lost the signal.  When I did get good reception, the picture/sound was good using Media Center.Recommendations:*Don't even bother with this unit, if you are not near TV stations. I think the instructions say 10 miles.  You may be able to get more with a roof top antenna, but I can do that on my TV.  The point of getting this unit in the first place was to get TV on my laptop.*Don't use the provided WinTV software.  Just use Windows Media Center.*Close all nonessential programs before running and I mean all.  This unit requires most of your CPU capacity and a lot of your memory.  I have 2 GB RAM and a 2.00 GHz ADM Turion 64 Mobile Processor and it works fine if I close all other software.

Reviews.Title: EyeTV Hybrid for a third of the price!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Hoogmoed "Jeff Hoogmoed"
Reviews.Content: If you own a Mac do not hesitate to buy this product. It works great with the excellent Elgato EyeTV software (I think version 3.2 and up).Its an EyeTV Hybrid for a third of the price.Although I believe it takes a pretty fast Mac to have a 1080HD picture.Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: TV on the go
Reviews.Author: sic5hifter "sic5hifter"
Reviews.Content: it's an awesome product to go with a laptop. take it anywhere and watch TV in HD. works well with windows media center. I settled for media center instead of the product's software because i can't get it installed(wintv7).get a premium antenna for better results. but the in-box antenna works just fine for me. now who needs cable

Reviews.Title: Windows 7 Certified
Reviews.Author: Michael T. Starnes "Telnitlykitiz"
Reviews.Content: This item is compatable with Windows 7. Hauppauge has several tuners which work with Windows 7 and a list can be found on their website. This item is 99 dollars at their website store! I will update this review when practical.

Reviews.Title: Does what it's supposed to.
Reviews.Author: Charmaine S. Krystal "Charmaine"
Reviews.Content: I didn't use the software included after reading suggestions to go the manufacturer's website and download the most recent driver there.  No problems.  Takes about 20 minutes for it to scan for channels.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge WinTV Tuner Review
Reviews.Author: David B. Petrin
Reviews.Content: This is a great gadget but you need a newer computer with the right amount of power to make it run properly. My current computer didn't make the grade. This was very disappointing for me. I had to return the unit to Amazon. But Amazon makes returns very easy. Thank you Amazon for good prices and good service. I will look in to this product again when I get a newer computer.David B. Petrin

Reviews.Title: Awsome
Reviews.Author: mcm_538
Reviews.Content: i purchased this product after buying a PCTV HD Mini stick which did not get analog channels so naturally i returned it and bought this one, the drivers are easy to install and so is the software, i found out they had an updated version on their web site which i like a lot better than the version 6 that came with it, however i d prefer windows media center with the downloaded TV guide and the preset recording settings so i can put recorded video on my portable Microsoft phone. the images come in clear and the audio is superb. and it works with my vista 64 bit operating system

Reviews.Title: Works Great on Mac.
Reviews.Author: Donald G. Mickles
Reviews.Content: This tuner works great on a Mac when combined with EyeTV.  I have it hooked up to my iMac.  Using it with Comcast.  Picks up ClearQAM and Basic Cable channels.  As for EyeTV, it is simple to setup and nice to use and the remote that comes with the tuner works well with EyeTV.  I would highly recommend this tuner to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for the money
Reviews.Author: S. Scully
Reviews.Content: Found like item at Best Buy for about $100.00 , so this unit was a better buy and works great, picture is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: J. Ford
Reviews.Content: Plugged it into a fresh Windows 7 RC build; drivers found automatically, Media Center was able to find ~20 channels right away with included antenna.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: JDN123
Reviews.Content: Easy to install, very good picture quality when connected to cable, and excellent HD picture quality for the available clear QAM channels (basically all the broadcast channels). The antenna that comes with it is very basic, so unless you have a good digital signal you will probably need to get a better antenna. Overall an excellent purchase at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge tuner
Reviews.Author: ejsfox
Reviews.Content: Purchased this tuner to use as an over the air battery backup TV duringthe many power outages here in Florida.  The tuner and the small antenna deliver a very good HD picture.  The included WinTV/WinTV Scheduler software is marginally usable on my Vista laptop.  I switched to using Windows Media Center, and now everything works as it should.

Reviews.Title: WinTv
Reviews.Author: Oketo Peters
Reviews.Content: I bought this product about a month ago and i am impressed by its performance.everything works the remote and the antena.the software is easy to use and to install.have no problems with this product.

Reviews.Title: WinTV-HVR Works well
Reviews.Author: Rolling15
Reviews.Content: Works great.  Installed on a Vista machine with SP1. No problems what so ever.

Reviews.Title: More junk made in China
Reviews.Author: Leslie Atherton
Reviews.Content: This product has been causing problems all along.Now it won't play tv for more than 5 minutes then it just quits.I have troubleshooted cables and everything. I have three DTV converterboxes that all work fine with the OTA signals. The HVR-950Q quit working.Tried it with Windows XP, Vista and Windows 7. All with same problem.

Reviews.Title: It has a ridicoulous requirement and can't pick up the signal if it's not strong enough.
Reviews.Author: Popeyes "Pop"
Reviews.Content: I just can't install it on my laptop because it needs use the original CD come with the package to install, even you can download the newest version from their website(which took forever). However my laptop doesn't have a CD-rom, I tried to copy all the files on the CD to a USB-flash drive, it didn't work. I don't understand why it has this requirement.I finally installed it on another computer(windows XP) that has a CD-rom and it works ok. But I did notice some stations were missed, which can be picked up by my HDTV using the same arena(cost more than $50). I think that's because I am far from the suburb.

Reviews.Title: Avoid this product
Reviews.Author: T. L. Rasmussen
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Hauppauge TV tuner card many years ago in order to use it with my Win98 machine; never worked worth a damn.  So I figured they would have only gotten better over a decade, right?  Wrong!  I have a new Windows 7 machine with 8 cores and more than enough horsepower.  This product works with Windows Media Center for about 7 minutes, then hangs.  WMC ends up reporting a "Low Bit Rate", but the hardware is frozen solid.  No amount of fiddling will get it to work again, except for a reboot of the system.  Then the Hauppauge POS will work again - for another two minutes.  Updated drivers did not help.  Rolling back the drivers did not help.If you want the ability to watch TV on your computer, buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Works well with some reservations.
Reviews.Author: Eric Johnson
Reviews.Content: Pics: Functions like a TV. Small and easy to use with a proper antenna. Allows me to watch local broadcast from my laptop.Nits: Scanning function only works all at once. Haven't figured out how to scan in different directions all at once. The remote only works if you boot computer while plugged in. Station acquisition is a little slow for HD stations.

Reviews.Title: I knew there was a way
Reviews.Author: Rhea Preston
Reviews.Content: Did exactly what I wanted. Took a Direct TV Sat box that we were not using put in on my table next to my chair and hooked the Hauppauge 1191 to it. Now if my wife is watching something im not interested in, I will just plug in the usb and watch what i want on the lap top---perfect!

Reviews.Title: Can't Reliably Scan Clear Digital Cable Channels
Reviews.Author: Thomas P. Brady
Reviews.Content: This tuner would not reliably scan and identify clear QAM digital cable channels.  At times it would not identify 15% or more of the channels.  As the software won't let you manually tune to a channel it did not detect, it makes this device pretty useless.  Manual tuning would be a big plus since it might overcome some of limitations as well as predefining a channel plan without scanning.

Reviews.Title: Crashes too much
Reviews.Author: Zdynobeat
Reviews.Content: I experienced crashes with the WinTV application that came with this product. If I maximized the window, it crashed. If I change the channel.. it crashed. I usually had to reboot my computer each time. I noticed the video and audio often fell out of sync. Somehow this product managed to take a simple activity such as watching television and making it a hassle. I ended up returning it and buying a stand-alone television. I'm much happier now.

Reviews.Title: Owch.  Not a good choice for Linux/Mythtv
Reviews.Author: Wayno Guerrini
Reviews.Content: Owch.  I need Linux compatibility with mythtv.  This didn't work, out of the box.  Fortunately, I am within the return window, so I will return this product.The software shipped with the product is way out of date.  Why uses Windows Software if my goal is Linux?Because if it doesn't work in Windows, it may not work with Linux.  On a dual-core machine running Windows 7 Professional, I installed the software on the disc.  It took over an hour  to install.  (Ohh, that's painful!)  The update to the latest version requires you to have the original disc (which I had) and also took, over an hour.  BOOOM!  You just blew over 2 hours time, that you will NEVER get back.  The tuner worked quirkly in Windows.  It displayed about 3 seconds of video, before freezing.  Okay it COULD be their "fine" software.Channel scans both ota, and with comcast cable (qam channels), yielded nothing in Mythtv.  No signal at all.  I believe this product is broken out-of-the-box.Several people on #mythtv-users on freenode.net recommended the hdhomerun.  It is more expensive, but several people have said it works out of the box.So I am returning this, and keeping my toes crossed!Waynopkill dash 9 dot com

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge 1191 Win TV-HVR-950Q - can only get one channel
Reviews.Author: Toi Patterson
Reviews.Content: I can only get one channel.  Also, I have to shut the computer down and restart after watching that ONE channel.  The remote does not work.

Reviews.Title: Tuner Defective
Reviews.Author: AHart
Reviews.Content: Had to return this item because the driver install disk was defective, also I choose to purchase another item, instead.

Reviews.Title: Tuner Defective
Reviews.Author: AHart
Reviews.Content: Had to return this item because the driver install disk was defective, also I choose to purchase another item, instead.

Reviews.Title: Not a great product
Reviews.Author: Drcssm
Reviews.Content: This was not a good quality product in my opinion. I couldn't get any channels on it. It didn't work at all.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Mark M"
Reviews.Content: Use with rabbit ear antenna - works great!  Not much else to say about it but they require a lot of words in a review!

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money
Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: A person really needs to understand what you are getting when buying a TV Tuner, which I didn't. Understanding what you have in your area for TV programs and how to access them is important. This TV Tuner couldn't be used for a lot of channels without added equipment in my area which is somewhat remote versus a big city.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Norma Dewbre
Reviews.Content: When I got this item I installed it and made sure it worked. Then waited for a camping trip to try it out. Going next week. Tested installation and it didn't work. Have worked with tech guy and he can't tell me why it just stopped working.  Have not been able to resolve the issue. Never even got a chance to use it and now I can't return it. Money wasted.

Reviews.Title: Only for the hard headed
Reviews.Author: ddsells97
Reviews.Content: I have tried multiple times to get the software and hardware to be recognized by my PC, but I continually have had the software freeze, or the hardware is no longer recognized when changing channels. I would only buy this if you like to be continually frustrated by glitchy software and non-responsive hardware (the USB connection fails quite a a bit).

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge 1191
Reviews.Author: HB
Reviews.Content: Product work great right out of the box. Had no problem installing.I would recommend this to a friend. It actually works better than I thought that have I read on some of the reviews. It works just as good as a regular HDTV.Con: The remote feel cheap. You can run the 1191 with the laptop which is easier or just use a universal remote that would solve the problem

Reviews.Title: Software Problems
Reviews.Author: J. Weber
Reviews.Content: The hardware works fine using Media Center but the software program to view TV with this product has been nothing but trouble.  It simply will not run despite all kinds of troubleshooting and web searches.  If you've got Media Center then this product works fine but if you're buying this and counting on the viewing program to use it, then you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Ubuntu: Works, with some elbow grease
Reviews.Author: Ruben M.
Reviews.Content: Spent quite a while trying to get this working well in Ubuntu. Kaffeine turned out to be the best solution. Could NOT get TV Time working for the life of me, and MythTV was much too complicated. Go with Kaffeine.Windows is another story. Plugged it right into my Windows machine and it worked great with Media Center.Don't recommend using a Windows VM, as the VM has trouble detecting/finding-drivers-for the Hauppauge tuner. Their included CD doesn't even detect it via VM.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: gregory malloy
Reviews.Content: the item works as good as describe by the package labeling. I get good clarity and high def picture from my basic cable line

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge 1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner
Reviews.Author: albert steward
Reviews.Content: Works great, simple to install, its so easy no need to read any installation instructions. Who does any way right?

Reviews.Title: veiw tv
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: very  easy to set up and thengood to go .nice  unit.Hauppauge 1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick/Personal Video Recorder with Clear QAM and Remote Control (Black)

Reviews.Title: Died so young.
Reviews.Author: Irv
Reviews.Content: I can't give much of a review as it died within an hour of it being plugged in. It set up fine in my windows 7 dual core athlon II using the windows media center setup with a comcast digital feed. It also recognized over the air digital channels in the area. I never tried out the included software or got to try the remote. Reliablity need a lot of improvement. Bought from J & R Music World. So far no problems with the return. P.S. The antenna is junk.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable Tuner
Reviews.Author: ejcole
Reviews.Content: I shoud have believed the negative reviews.After several trys I got it to install and find the QAM and analog channels via cable TV.Trying to view the analog hangs up the PC.Sometimes the low end QAM are viewable, but then are stop and go and hang up. The HD channels hang up the PC.This is on an XP-SP3, 2.4gz, 2.5GB Ram, USB 2.0 PC, as the requirements state.I hope I can return it to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: TV Tuner for Laptop/PC
Reviews.Author: Gadget Seeker
Reviews.Content: Item is great for using computer as a TV. The pictures are clear & the sound is great with the analog cable channels. However, something I noticed with the 5 unscrambled digital cable channels is that the audio has a crackling sound. I didn't get that sound with any of the analog cable channels. Is it a limitation of the tv tuner or is it something that the cable company does to the unscrambled digital ABC, NBC, CBS, FOX & PBS channels that they are required to give basic cable subscribers? Would welcome any comments on this.

Reviews.Title: My Hauppauge Win TV-HVR-950Q experience
Reviews.Author: Burt I. Weiner "BIWA"
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that it can receive analog signals as well as digital signals.  My work requires me to be able to look at the few remaining analog signals still out there for the purpose of interference tracking.  Installation was easy and straight forward.  My only complaint is that the WIN-TV software is not very intuitive.  Even after you learn where everything is and what they call it, it's still a bit cumbersome.I live in an area where I'm only 12 miles away and line of sight to all of the Los Angeles TV transmitters.  The supplied antenna is marginal at best when used inside - Yes, I pullled the whip out to its full length.  It would also be nice if the whip had a magnetic base.The only thing I really wish it would do different would be to display noise instead of muting when the signal approaches or goes below the noise floor.  Maybe they could make muting an optional setting?  I use it on my ASUS G2 laptop, which is running XP-pro. I have no regrets in buying this product.

Reviews.Title: Almost Great
Reviews.Author: Ronald C. Ward
Reviews.Content: Software is buggy. Using scan for local tv stations the program ask you to enter zip code, I entered my zip code and found out i could get 13 channels. I put the antenna in another area in my room and re-scanned for stations and I got 15 channels. I went to the Hauppauge site and downloaded the pertaining up dated drivers.  I still have thesame 15 stations. Credit to this tv tuner, small portable LCD panel TV have the same problem. I live in a metroarea and the main tv stations are 15+ miles away. This usb tv tuner need an outside antenna and don't use your zip good for a reference for local stations.

Reviews.Title: OK, But Room For Improvement
Reviews.Author: C.
Reviews.Content: I have Eye TV for Mac at home, which is outstanding. Unfortunately, we're still on PCs at work, so when I purchased this to bring my TV signal to my desktop, I hoped that it would work as well as Eye TV. Not quite. While the picture quality is outstanding and it pulls in lots of digital channels that basic cable doesn't otherwise provide, it provides absolutely no guide to figure out which channel is which -- you are left to scroll until you find the channel you're looking for. (Eye TV has a channel and program guide that updates automatically). Also, it sometimes destabilizes my PC when I change channels.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: S. Segura "Seseva"
Reviews.Content: Great product...just be aware that if you want to record TV programs you will need a LOT of HD space.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Gabriel L. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Everyone please read this post.I bought the original WinTV- HVR 950 TV Turner to watch High Def TV on my laptop. I was having problems with the software that came with the package was out of date. Uninstall everything, then go to the Hauppauge website, download the latest software, burn the files on a cd for a easy installation (once you pop the cd into the drive, auto play will run) then the software won't crash anymore. I don't know everyone's hardware but mine is very basic and i'm getting optimal performance because of the latest software updates. Channels still load a little slow but it really doesn't bother me. For any product that you buy for you pc, always go to their website to check for the latest drivers.Since the analog age is now over; Comcast is now cutting out the expanded basic cable but I'm getting digital TV. I might have to get 950Q or just watch over the air high def TV. I live in the Atlanta, Georgia area so we do get a ton of options plus NCIS comes out on iOn and CBS.Update as of 10/16/2009Apparently I'm writing this review late on purpose because I needed a lot of time to test my new 950Q Tuner. It's very good and it's meets my expectation while using this product on my laptop. I guess I'm the first person writing this review to y'all on my Windows 7 computer (beta tester). It gave me the "Blue Screen of Death" because Windows 7 did not had an update for my video card but more than two months ago, I installed the latest drivers for my pc plus the manufacture released the Windows 7 drivers for the product. Now I'm currently subscribing to Comcast Digital TV like I previously mentioned before. So satellite subscribers, sorry this will be wrong product for you. This product enables me to receive "unscrambled QAM" TV" which means it doesn't give me all of the channels that a normal digital tv box would get. The good news is I get a 90% of the channels that I watch the most with a few local channels. Even when I click the "enable encrypted channels" it spits out just a few more. I made the huge mistake of changing the settings on Windows Media Center because it was giving me all of the QAM local channels. It's was very convenient for me because I can watch NCIS on CBS Atlanta or my local news while I do my other things. Using the over the air antenna gives me perfect results but mainly in the living room. Oh well..I'm planning to buy a much powerful computer with the super sweet nvidia GeForce 220 graphics card. Hopefully this product will totally rock out even more. YUP YUP, THAT'S WHAT'S UP! LOL.Update 12/18/2009I just downloaded the updated version just like you posted and it rocks even more! Guys make sure you keep that original CD that came with the product because it's going to ask for it if you download the software from the Hauppauge Website. The interface is somewhat disappointing because it lacks "go back" to the last channel button however the channels loads like a regular TV so they actually succeeded this time. Another improvement, I'm getting more QAM channels than before (with some Atlanta local stations) while the channels that I watch the most is still there. Do your Windows updates, install the latest updates for the products and you'll be fine. :-)

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Gabriel L. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Everyone please read this post.I bought the original WinTV- HVR 950 TV Turner to watch High Def TV on my laptop. I was having problems with the software that came with the package was out of date. Uninstall everything, then go to the Hauppauge website, download the latest software, burn the files on a cd for a easy installation (once you pop the cd into the drive, auto play will run) then the software won't crash anymore. I don't know everyone's hardware but mine is very basic and i'm getting optimal performance because of the latest software updates. Channels still load a little slow but it really doesn't bother me. For any product that you buy for you pc, always go to their website to check for the latest drivers.Since the analog age is now over; Comcast is now cutting out the expanded basic cable but I'm getting digital TV. I might have to get 950Q or just watch over the air high def TV. I live in the Atlanta, Georgia area so we do get a ton of options plus NCIS comes out on iOn and CBS.Update as of 10/16/2009Apparently I'm writing this review late on purpose because I needed a lot of time to test my new 950Q Tuner. It's very good and it's meets my expectation while using this product on my laptop. I guess I'm the first person writing this review to y'all on my Windows 7 computer (beta tester). It gave me the "Blue Screen of Death" because Windows 7 did not had an update for my video card but more than two months ago, I installed the latest drivers for my pc plus the manufacture released the Windows 7 drivers for the product. Now I'm currently subscribing to Comcast Digital TV like I previously mentioned before. So satellite subscribers, sorry this will be wrong product for you. This product enables me to receive "unscrambled QAM" TV" which means it doesn't give me all of the channels that a normal digital tv box would get. The good news is I get a 90% of the channels that I watch the most with a few local channels. Even when I click the "enable encrypted channels" it spits out just a few more. I made the huge mistake of changing the settings on Windows Media Center because it was giving me all of the QAM local channels. It's was very convenient for me because I can watch NCIS on CBS Atlanta or my local news while I do my other things. Using the over the air antenna gives me perfect results but mainly in the living room. Oh well..I'm planning to buy a much powerful computer with the super sweet nvidia GeForce 220 graphics card. Hopefully this product will totally rock out even more. YUP YUP, THAT'S WHAT'S UP! LOL.Update 12/18/2009I just downloaded the updated version just like you posted and it rocks even more! Guys make sure you keep that original CD that came with the product because it's going to ask for it if you download the software from the Hauppauge Website. The interface is somewhat disappointing because it lacks "go back" to the last channel button however the channels loads like a regular TV so they actually succeeded this time. Another improvement, I'm getting more QAM channels than before (with some Atlanta local stations) while the channels that I watch the most is still there. Do your Windows updates, install the latest updates for the products and you'll be fine. :-)

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Joseph H. Allard "Gamer"
Reviews.Content: Well, all I can say is that it works. It installed by itself. The only exceptions are that the remote is useless and that it takes a long time to load. The remote doesn't work. I have to use the Comcast Cable remote to change channels. Otherwise it's ok. It really isn't anything to write home about.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Nate
Reviews.Content: The software installed easily and the TV works as it should.  This is a great TV at a great price.

Reviews.Title: A OK
Reviews.Author: Sid A. Leibson
Reviews.Content: Came with a broken remote!!!  Other than that the unit delivers very good picture quality

Reviews.Title: Surprised
Reviews.Author: M. Barrera
Reviews.Content: Easy installation and reception is excellent where I live. I am getting over forty (40)digital channels.  I was not expecting too much and all I could say was wow. I hooked up my Epsom 70 projector and have a wide screen that looks as good as my Sony 40 inch, without the reflections.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: Kim Lesniak
Reviews.Content: This baby works great! I have used Win-TV in the past but the newer models work so much better.  I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: M. Wegner
Reviews.Content: Tuner works well with both my Windows XP and Vista notebooks.  I'm especially amazed at how many stations I can pick up with the simple one-ear antenna that came with the tuner.  Hauppauge recording software works well on XP but won't install properly on Vista.  Hauppauge tech support was worthless.  But the tuner works well with Windows media center, so I don't need the Haupauge software on the Vista computer.

Reviews.Title: Works OK, but software is mediocre
Reviews.Author: Antonius Van Overbeek
Reviews.Content: The tuner itself works ok. In fact there are 2 separate tuners, 1 analog and 1 digital.The software (windows only) works, but is not very good.Had to fight with Vista UAC, since I am running with a non priviledged user account.

Reviews.Title: hauppauge wintv-hvr-9500 tv tuner stick
Reviews.Author: Waltraud H. Hern
Reviews.Content: excellent service prompt shipping,great product,in my area i needto add a bigger antenna.i got about 10 channels

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: Snowtrooper22
Reviews.Content: i purchased this for a gift for my wife and she absolutely loves it and so do i .... with a 3 year old in the house watching noggin(child channel on directv), now we get to see our shows on our computer with no problems. channels come in high def very clear with no snow. we just put up the anntena and channels come in crisp and clear...we've had no problems with it..

Reviews.Title: HVR-950Q : USELESS PIECE OF JUNK. DO NOT BUY IT!
Reviews.Author: David Barrios
Reviews.Content: Bought it 20 days ago. Let me make a brief description of my experience with my brand new Hauppauge HVR-950Q:- On a powerful laptop, windows 7, it capture video, and freeze after 10-20 seconds. Several people notify the same problem on his forums. No solution for that.- Installed, reinstalled, version 1.2, 1.3, 1.3a, 1.3b, move this, install that. Nothing worked.- on Media Center: Tuner not working.- Tech support: I had to wait 5 days for every email, asking stupid questions ("is it a laptop or a pc?" "are you using wintv?").- Tried to install a complete different system, with windows XP, met all requirements. It says compatible hardware not found!!!Tried everything! I can't even return this piece of useless junk, because I'm not where i sold it (atlanta). 4 weeks of wasted time. so make yourself a favor and spend that 80 dollars on something else, no matter what, DO NOT DO NOT BUY THIS DO NOT BUY THIS DO NOT BUT THIS!!!!

Reviews.Title: Over-priced & Under-developed
Reviews.Author: John R. Maier
Reviews.Content: What's to be said when I've tried it on an older Thinkpad with Pentium and XP, a top T60p Centrino Core Duo2 with Vista Business and the latest Thinkpad T500 Élite CTO with Centrino vPro + Vista Buisness. This turkey gets 2 of the 5 area on-air channels! E-ing mfr got squat = expensive paperweight!

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: Jose Caraballo "JJFluffy"
Reviews.Content: This device is absolutely terrible and for 1 reason.  You can't manually input channels.  so if when you are scanning for channels, there is one specific channel that you know you get (maybe sometimes you have to play with your antenna to receive it) if when scanning the tuner doesnt see the channel in the 2 seconds it looks for it.  thats it, your channels to watch that channel are gone.  you have absolutely NO chance, or options ANYWHERE TO MANUALLY ENTER THE CHANNEL, THEN PLAY WITH YOUR ANTENNA UNTIL YOU RECEIVE IT. . how can you possible create a device, a TUNER that you can't manually enter a channel, absolutely ridiculous, RIDICULOUS

Reviews.Title: Didn't receive a remote control
Reviews.Author: Dips
Reviews.Content: I received my order quickly and everything works fine. Hardware was easy to install/setup. I use Windows Media Center, didn't even bother installing vendor software. I receive excellent over the air HD reception with the included antenna. The only problem I have is that the remote control was not in the box. As stated in the title and description I ordered a "Hauppauge WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick/Personal Video Recorder with Clear QAM and REMOTE CONTROL". The packing slip I received had a note in the comments that read "Brand New, Never used. NO REMOTE INCLUDED! Comes in box". I'm not sure who wrote that comment, but I ordered a tuner stick with remote. I have submitted a complaint with the Amazon merchant that I placed the order with and I will update my review upon hearing back from them.

Reviews.Title: Jerky on Windows 7
Reviews.Author: You can call me Mike "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I bought this when I bought a new 64-bit 4GB Windows 7 system and my 950 quit working.  On a Windows 7 system where everything is much faster than XP, I was surprised to see the jerky video on this thing.  Increasing process priority in task manager didn't help.  Neither did getting the latest drivers and software from Hauppauge.Later, I switched the device to another USB port and the jerkiness went away.  I can't figure out why but it seems to work ok now.Remote control doesn't work at all.  Maybe the included battery is dead.

Reviews.Title: NEED HELP!!!
Reviews.Author: JR "da ill wun"
Reviews.Content: This item is great if it had a great software to go with it. But, it doesn't leaving me to give it the two stars it was given. The HD recording is awesome, "TRUE QAM!" But the software sells it short leaving you with glitches and gaps that can no longer be filled when recording digital cable/tv.

Reviews.Title: Good product, particularly for digital channels
Reviews.Author: J. Huang
Reviews.Content: I bought this one as the gift and it works very good. For annalog channels, the signal is not very good but you can fine-tune it. For digital ones, it works the best and the signal is so good. I like the tunner a lot and think it worths it.

Reviews.Title: This is a waste of money
Reviews.Author: HSB
Reviews.Content: If you've got Comcast, this tuner is a waste of time.  For the first two months I owned it, everything worked like a charm.  Since Comcast has switched up its frequencies, however, I've only been able to receive a handful of local and shop-at-home channels.  Tried everything to correct, but this seems like a common problem with Comcast customers, just run a Google query.  Safe yourself the heartache and avoid this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Fails at the one thing is shouldn't
Reviews.Author: Ronin
Reviews.Content: I've had this tuner for about two weeks, connected to Windows 7 with Media Center.  It records commercials with ease and matched with the Media Center guide it's a breeze to setup recording times.  However, when it comes to recording the television shows I want for viewing later... I do get a picture and the sound effects, but no vocals.  I tried contacting Hauppauge, but they have failed to respond.  If you're looking to record commercials for the super bowl, by all means purchase.  If you want to watch a drama, look elsewhere.PS  The supplied software from Hauppauge (Win 7) is utter trash, no radio, no scheduler, just a simple tuner that can do still screen captures.

Reviews.Title: Great condition
Reviews.Author: Huli
Reviews.Content: The thing came as it was described, it was missing some stuff, but it said that when I ordered it. Came in mail quickly, great condition, no scratches or things like that. Works pretty good. Didn't know you have to pay for the software.

Reviews.Title: Poor performance
Reviews.Author: Tom Carson
Reviews.Content: Remote control didn't work.  Antenna was poor.  I have to reboot my computer a few times each time I try to start WinTV.  It usually takes me about 30 minutes to get it working.  I have to plan at least one sit-com in advance if I want to watch a particular show.  I'm using a Celeron 3600 MHz with 4GB RAM.  It would have been cheaper to buy a new flat screen TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: W. Montero
Reviews.Content: This product does what it supposes to do... excellent system, easy to install and use... not a high definition but kite acceptable...

Reviews.Title: The remote control needs work...
Reviews.Author: Willie
Reviews.Content: The remote control doesn't work very often, needs to be very near the tuner stick when it does and I think for me, is a usless accessory.

Reviews.Title: hauppauge wintv-hvr950q tv card.
Reviews.Author: Terry Klopfenstein "classic vehicles"
Reviews.Content: i like the hauppauge 950q wintv- hvr 950q tv card because it gave a very clear picture once i downloaded the software, and played around with the computer awhile to get it to let me watch tv. the only down side that i have with it is that i live five miles from the illinois/wisconsin stateline, which means that getting wisconsin television stations is impossible for me to get in, even with the amplified hd attenna,unless i get subscribe to sattube.

Reviews.Title: ClearQAM and Comcast in MA
Reviews.Author: S. Reeve
Reviews.Content: Not so much a review but a question:  will this work with Comcast in MA?I ordered this three years ago and then returned it.If I remember correctly, there were a few Comcast channels that were not in ClearQAM format.And I needed to record those channels, so it was a no-go.Of course it can be wildly different now.Any comments would be appreciated.Also: anyone know if the WinTV-HVR-950Q will record in a format that a DLNA client can decode?Three stars for now, let's hope I pull the trigger and later becomes a 5-star.Running Windows 8 Enterprise, so Windows Media Center can't be used (MSFT has made it so that WMC can't go on 8Ent)So I'll be looking for alternatives to schedule recordings - Hauppauge SW will suffice but I may look around for others.

Reviews.Title: Warning Netbook users- requires original CD for all software intalls.
Reviews.Author: Doctor C
Reviews.Content: Originally I gave this 3 stars.  It requires a very strong antenna (stronger than the one that ships with it for sure), or cable (with QAM). If you have those, it's pretty decent, but runs hot.I am now giving this product 2 stars because I discovered that if you damage or lose the original CD-ROM that comes with this, there is no way to install the WinTV7 software without sending them an extra $9.95 for a replacement CD.  You read right.  Even when you DOWNLOAD the software, you still need the original CD-ROM.I had to do a reinstall of my OS and tried to install this and discovered my CD was cracked and pretty much every other piece of hardware I own usually has updated versions of the software online anyway so this was no big deal I thought and downloaded the latest version of this online.  Then in the middle of the installation, the program asks to insert the original CD.I talked with tech support and they told me point blank to pay up or they won't give me replacement software.  There is absolutely no technical reason for this other than greed.  I have a 10 year old laser printer and can still download the software for it online.  My backup external drive has it online, my 8 year old router still has software online, and I could go on and on so I really don't understand how they expect people to keep every original CD for hardware.On another note, what about Netbook users?  how would they install the software for this?  CD drives are soon going to be obsolete in favor of USB and online installs so at this point, don't waste your money on this.  Companies like this deserve to go out of business.

Reviews.Title: does not work with most computers
Reviews.Author: Dogfish
Reviews.Content: I have now used two different hauppage products with my windows xp media center pc.  These do not work.  Do the research and you'll find that most people who buy these report that windows media center will simply stop recognizing them for no reason, and after that happens you will never again get your pc to recognize a hauppauge t.v. tuner.  Save yourself some time and money and steer clear of this rubbish.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Product for the Price
Reviews.Author: Sanford Pennies "Sanford Pennies"
Reviews.Content: I have followed this product for the last 3-4 months. I bought it on sale for about $50,installed it on both my laptop(DELL dual core) and my desktop(2yr old cheap Compaq w AMD SEMPRON 1.8). I have had NO problems with the unit or the software. I find that there are 2 groups of people who complain about this product...A group...The computer "experts" that start analizing it to death before they get it out of the box.Typically genius types that are brilliant in their own minds...but don't read simple English that well.....Then there is group B...The fashion folks...It worked well but the remote felt like a graham cracker in my hand so I took it back to the store and bought a four thousand dollar HDTV instead. HEY!!!!!!! You get a TV and a DIGITAL recorder for $50 that works on your laptop. Don't listen to the nay sayers....Oh yeah I almost forgot the 3rd group....The software sellers...I have a program that I wrote in my garage that works better than Hauppauges team of engineers and scientists program....Yeah...Right!!! Don't listen to the whiners and LIARS....and  the folks that won't read the instructions.....THIS IS A GREAT PRODUCT FOR $50....

Reviews.Title: Didn't get a single channel.
Reviews.Author: Zoe
Reviews.Content: Waste of time, returned immediately, couldn't find a single channel.Got a new different antenna & picked up 35 channels.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Terry R Swearman
Reviews.Content: Tuner is weak. You get lots of pixelated images and it runs HOT. Wouldn't recommend this device to anyone. I don't have this problem with my DTV TV. So be advised!

Reviews.Title: 1st Time 1star reviews are believable.
Reviews.Author: K. Whitson
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this tuner. I tried all the suggested fixes to get this to work and could only get this to work about 30 minutes ay a time at the most. Not sure why it stops working but it does. The longer it is on the faster it freezes up after restarting it. Returned for refund.  Refund/ return process went very well.

Reviews.Title: This Rocks!!! Sans Doze!
Reviews.Author: Greg Keeney "A4P"
Reviews.Content: I've been a Hauppauge buyer since the ISA card days for 15+ years.The 350 still a main stay though now has been outpaced!The 950 USB version which rocked (pre DTV mandate).The 950Q version is AWESOME!I bought a 1600 PCI card....Booooo! Returned it within 24 hours!Even with a HDTV roof antenna attached.No signal, and look at the back, a MAC address!Being a Non-Doze person my logs could see that the 1600 was a Ether NIC collecting info and sending, well....Doze people would NEVER know, for puppy dogs help them "search".The 1600 is a SERIOUS breach of security,OK, here is the review on the 950Q!IT ROCKS!!!In *NIX land, no installation necessary, no software, just RUNS!!!And WOW does it RUN!Best DVB receiver I have!Yes to be honest, via Win7, and all their "Ya have to have"! I tested it!Major NO WAY!No go on MOST of the channels and, capturing is fragmented "At Best"The 950Q does 1080p yeppers (p) and in AWESOME raw capture mode.If one wants a GREAT PVR, get a 950Q, (sans Doze) and ENJOY better than the tripe from cable and satellite (which they call Clear-QAM, "made up", just MPEG2-TS...Low quality compression)A 950Q sans Doze is THE "BEST BUY" (pun intended)!Go Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: I love my Hauppauge
Reviews.Author: Rick J "frj11"
Reviews.Content: Simply one of the best and most useful additions you can make to a Windows 7 computer system.  I am now able to get TV from broadcast stations as well as from the internet.  In fact there are so many good choices it is astounding.  I can even watch the nightly news while I continue to use the pc to discuss a client's problems and fix that problem all the while being able to keep up with the rest of the world.

Reviews.Title: Hauppauge Wintv
Reviews.Author: rickbob
Reviews.Content: I am dissappointed to learn after trying to insatll and use on my laptop that I am required to make a long distance phone call to New York in order to get permission to use this device on a laptop. So i decided to use it thru Windows media center instead .I wish they had told me that B4 I purchased the item.

Reviews.Title: Claims HDTV Compatible NO WAY!!!!
Reviews.Author: Darrell P Emerson
Reviews.Content: I called customer service to find out how to attach my High Def satellite output to the tuner. It receives the digital and analog TV signals but it does not have a high def input. Go figure that. You can watch all your high def TV but in 480i as it does not support it in HD. Confusing? It will let you watch it but at lower resolutions supported by the two input connections on the tuner. Beware of HD claims of compatibility - Just because you can watch it doesn't mean it comes out in HDMI format. I bought this tuner because it was on the compatibility list issued by Windows 7. i wonder how much they had to pay MS to turn their back on the HD issue?

Reviews.Title: Totally Worthless
Reviews.Author: Justin Baker
Reviews.Content: 1. This isn't designed to be easy to use.2. I installed the drivers and the software and then did the channel search as the instruction manual said I should, but no channels were found so I can't watch any TV.  I live in Chicago so there are plenty of channels to be found if their device actually worked.3. I went to their website to call customer service and found out that they only accept calls from 8:30AM-6PM EST on WEEKDAYS.  I brought this to watch a Sunday football game so why should I have to wait until I go to work on during the week to call about their product.You are better off not even trying this piece of Junk.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely JUNK!!! DON'T waste your money. Hauppauge support is even worst then Amazon. For over 6 months I have tried to get ?
Reviews.Author: August C. Cassiato Asee
Reviews.Content: Absolutely JUNK!!! DON'T waste your money on the Hauppauge 950Q Tuner NTSC/ATSC/QAM it is totally trash Their software needed updated right off the back and there was a threat if you did not have their CD you would have to pay $10 more bucks. unit #1 the remote NEVER WORKED. I called them and after five emails they sent me another remote that was not the problem, unit #2 had a new style remote and a different software disc version but the composite input from my DVD player NEVER WORKED ON EITHER UNIT.Unit # 3 was opened when I received it a& weighed a full pound heaver so I was not opening it. Hauppauge support is even worst then Amazon. NEVER have I purchased electronics (I usually I order from Walmart online their cheaper and when there is a problem you just go to the closet store) at Amazon, they just keep BSing you until you get sick of it & just through the product away.For over 6 months I have tried to get anything in repalcement after trying THREE different units the last one they sent me was open THEY CHARGED ME A RESTOCKING FEE!!!!!!!!!! This place is outrageous!!!!!!!!I cannot believe the way things went when I tried to get help because when I started to return the opened Hauppauge  TV TUNER the person I was trying to communicate with could not speak English well enough to understand me telling her the problem I am having!I was on the phone over 30 minutes with her and still have no idea if the refund I am anticipating will be issued in a form I can use & NOT back on the Amazon credit card which has a zero balance.I spoke with a person, to return a third Hauppauge TV tuner that had been opened when I received it I did not open it and sent it back today with MUCH GRIEF this time and its weight was a full pound heaver then the two previous ones.If I cannot find help with your company, why would I continue to do business with your company?I tried to tell this girl that my Amazon credit card was with a zero balance and DID NOT want a credit to go there. I would prefer to put it toward a Kindle Fire HD as I has spoken to whoever that is, and I wanted to wait.Things kept going wrong and worse with the girl I just had on the phone & after 45 minutes, I could not hold the phone any longer as I am disabled and told her that.She still wanted me to hold on and placed me on hold.After 5 more minutes I hung up and still have no idea what is going to happen to the $68.99 I have already paid & my credit card is NOT where I wish the credit to go.I could not even get it across to her that there were three of these units and this one had been opened before I got it.There is something in the box rattling around that your company should exercise caution when you open it as it weighs 1 pound more than the two previous ones I received.I am extremely upset.To add to that, when I asked her to call me back after she found out the answer to my problem, she put me on hold again.I am just about through with Amazon.The size & scope of your company is getting out of control.I am constantly getting emails.Then when I tried to find the RMA for the third & FINAL product I purchased, (how fast can you look through 500Gigs of storage to find it) she kept on with the need to tell me something or talk to something or someone else.Right now I am so upset I would rather go to Walmart and pay the difference then to deal with this hassle anymore.All I wanted to do was get the unit returned for one of s I could afford.Not only did I have this hassle but the reason for calling in the first place was UPS messed up before as they did today, the original reason I tried to call in the first place.I had to chase after the UPS driver that did not pick up the last package and left the new replacement unit on the front porch in the open & basically on the street in a new Amazon box that was not opened; however, he opened the door (which it fit behind where I had the second one placed for pickup) to put a sticker on the door that he was here and did not pick up the box at his feet & that it was a first attempt to pick up the defective unit.With that in mind when I saw him leaving the community I live in this morning, I asked him if he picked it up today & he did not have a notion of what I was talking about.He waited while I came home got the package and went back where I found him (he did not come to my house I had to chase him down) handed it to the driver.He took it and gave me NOTHING in exchange; no package receipt, no label stub, nothing.After that, I call Amazon thinking I would get some help and what I got was a very long hassle from a person I could not understand and asked for a supervisor that I did not get a chance to talk to.What is going on?I had good intent to give all my business to your company but now am gun shy of it.I guess I am just out the monies and the Kindle Fire, well, if this is the support you get with electronics less than $100 you can forget it.I can't even talk to anyone about the trouble.I will just purchase an Apple or something or one someplace else.their nasty gram is:If you're due a refund you'll receive another e-mail confirmation shortly.See our return policy for our returns timeline at www.amazon.com/help/returnsWe look forward to seeing you again soon.Note: YOU CANNOT SEND e-mails TO THEM BECAUSE THEY USE -->  ... sent from a notification-only e-mail address that cannot accept incoming e-mail. Please do not reply to this message.

ProductInfo.Features:
Watch live HDTV or analog and clear QAM cable TV on your PC or laptop Record your favorite TV shows to your computer
TV StandardsNTSC Analog Cable, Over the Air TV ATSC Digital Over the Air HDTV Clear QAM Digital Cable TV
Watch high definition ATSC digital TV or analog cable TV on your PC or laptop screen!
Includes Hauppauge's WinTV v6 application to watch and record TV in a window or full screen.
Watch and record clear QAM digital cable TV. Clear QAM are digital cable TV programs transmitted on your cable TV network "in the clear".
Analog TV recordings will typically consume 1.5 Gb of disk space per hour.
Analog cable TV tuner built-in. Record analog TV shows to your PC's hard disk using our SoftPVR? MPEG-2 encoder.
Easy to install, easy to carry. Includes remote control and portable TV antenna
Many cable operators transmit the high definition local TV channels using clear QAM.
Watch and record cable TV or over-the-air ATSC high definition digital TV. programs, in a window or full screen on your PC or laptop monitor.
With WinTV-Scheduler, so you can record your favorite TV programs daily, weekly or once only.
ProductInfo.Name: Hauppauge 1191 WinTV-HVR-950Q TV Tuner Stick/Personal Video Recorder with Clear QAM and Remote Control (Black)
